160501.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Team GB, a special edition for funding purposes of the Olympic Games 2012 in London, United Kingdom.
160501.name: Monopoly: Team GB

160502.name: Pointing Fingers
160502.description: Who's done what? You'll find out in the hilarious game of Pointing Fingers! You'll also find out how well you know your family and friends in this fast-paced question-and-answer game. Each person reads a question from one of the cards, then everyone else selects how often they've done it on their Truth Meters. Then you point out who you think has done it the most with your funny Foam Finger! If you're right, you score. Don't miss out on the big laughs and hilarious discoveries of the Pointing Fingers game!

160503.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Migros, a company in the Netherlands.
160503.name: Monopoly: Cross-Selling Edition Flynth

160504.name: Mind Force
160504.description:
From publisher blurb:

For the Narrator who has everything... Except Time! TYPE Casting: Mind Force contains five character archetypes brimming with psychic power to bring mental mayhem to your BASH! UE games. Simply pick a TYPE, season to taste, and BASH! like you mean it.

160505.name: Street Tough
160505.description:
From publisher blurb:

Stalking the dark alleys and mean streets of the city comes Street Tough, the fourth installment of the TYPE Casting series. This issue handles five street themed archetypes to use for your BASH UE games. Each type comes with a High and Low end template, plus plenty of options to help players jump right in and Narrators to season to taste (to help or hinder their players)! These types come ready for whatever the big city has to throw at them. No street is too tough or too mean!

Engage, Enjoy, and BASH! like you mean it!

This file comes with a standard file for use on PC's and a low res file for use on tablets and other mobile digital devices.

160506.name: Cosmic Crusaders
160506.description:
From publisher blurb:

From the dark reaches of space comes COSMIC CRUSADERS, the third installment of the TYPE Casting series. This issue displays five space themed archetypes to use for your BASH UE games. Each type comes with a High and Low end template, plus plenty of options to help players jump right in and Narrators to season to taste (to help or hinder their players)!

Engage, Enjoy, and BASH! like you mean it!

This file comes with a standard file for use on PC's and a low res file for use on tablets and other mobile digital devices.

160507.name: Scavenger Hunt
160507.description:
From publisher blurb:

Scavenger Hunt is a perfect introduction for new students to East Texas University. The heroes must gather components for a ritual that will seal a gateway to the other side. Finding blue chalk might be easy, but where on earth are they going to find tiger fur and a god's drinking cup in six hours?

Scavenger Hunt is a frantic race around the campus of East Texas University for a party of Freshman (Novice Rank characters). This adventure gives you a taste of the [East Texas University] setting book so it isn't required to play. You will need Savage Worlds or the free Savage Worlds Test Drive rules, however.

160508.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from
V8 Supercars, a touring car racing category based in Australia.
160508.name: Monopoly: V8 Supercars Australia Charity Edition

160509.name: Knightly Tide
160509.description:
From publisher blurb:

With gorgeous cover art done by Nick Ladd, this collection of playbooks for the RPG Dungeon World will allow you to take on the role as virtuous characters who possess honor, chivalry and a righteous heart. This bundle will grant four new classes of holy armored warriors to your Dungeon World games as you adequately cleave, smash, smite, blast and impale any evil your party encounters.

The Lancer: Play a glory seeking knight who specializes in riding down foes and winning hearts at tournaments. Although more self-centered than most righteous warriors, The Lancer is no less vigilant or willing to defeat countless villains and monster then other saintly warriors.
The Redemption Seeker: A sinner who has forsaken their past blasphemous ways and now takes up the mantle of a fanatic holy warrior who will purge evil from this world with his perpetually battle frenzied zeal.
The Sorcerous Templar: A crusader who has sought out the secrets of studied magic and uses its power to guide the party on their quests or to banish dark forces. The magic the Sorcerous Templar studies is of the same ilk that wizards use, but his faith in just gods is no less than the spell casting clerics of his order.
The Turtle Knight: A strange knight form a foreign land who has travelled to this less savory realm to root out all cowards and villains and bring them the justice they deserve. The people of your home land, for lack of a better description, are giant turtle people. Your appearance my look silly to some of the locals, but such notions of comedy are lost as your massive armored hulk comes crashing down on the vile souls who stand before you.

160510.name: Fate of the World
160510.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fate of the World contains four playbooks of player classes for Dungeon World that has gorgeous cover art done by Nick Ladd. This pack features the figures that rise to the challenge of saving the world when darkness falls upon the land.

The Fated Hero: You are a figure who is at the heart of every myth and fairy tale. You are the knight in shining armor; you are the hero who will save the world! You and your allies go on whirlwind adventures, traveling to forgotten cities, busy capitals and devious dungeons for the sake of saving the world.
The Mentor: You are the wise and enigmatic senior of great understanding who oversees the training and guidance of new adventures out on their quests across the realm. You offer them insight and guidance in fluid and often poetic life lessons. However, when things get rough, you are no slouch in a fight. Use your aged intellect to direct you younger allies, and failing that, you have a few tricks up your sleeves to deal with whatever the world throws your way.
The Prophet: Nothing can spare you from the visions the gods mercilessly grant you, but if the fate of the world will ever be fought for, you will be the first to know. Use your visions of things that may come to warn your fellow adventures before it it’s too late or see great tragedies about to befall the world. Religiously raised folk see these visions as a blessing and holy duty they must attend as others suffer it as a punishment from above and try to shun it.
The Fateless Hero: You have spent your life dreaming of the day when you would become an exalted hero, saving the world from utter ruin and fulfilling prophecies. However, the acrimonious truth is that you are unseen by the threads of destiny and are cursed to be forever forgotten. The gods have no plan for you. There is no greater force in the universe that has included you in their design. You lie to yourself and promise to do great things, but almost mockingly; all the glory and recognition you seek seem to slip through your fingers and is given to others.

160511.name: Dark & Twisted
160511.description:
From publisher blurb:

This collection of playbooks for the RPG Dungeon World will allow you to take on the role as mentally unsound, amoral monsters that will bring their dark talents to your adventuring party. These four classes bring a dark, grungy, gritty texture of depravity to your everyday group of heroes up and on the rise.

The Abomination: Either through primitive science or cruel magics, you have be turned into a disfigured creature, who continues to deform and mutate as he explores the world. Eventually by the end of your journey, without any chance of a cure, you should be a shambling mountain of flesh and limbs. Embrace your new found malformed form and show other what good a few extra arms can do.
The Butcher: The Butcher, whether being portrayed as a professional killer looking for a job or a person who has too much free time on their hands and a yearning for murder, you play a psychopathic slasher who puts his homicide skill set to use by being part of adventuring party. I mean, adventures kill stuff all the time, don’t they? It’s just that you take it to a far more personal level of pleasure in ending the life of another.
The Eater of Dead: Wracked with a strange curse, you suffer from a macabre hunger that drives you to consume the dead flesh of sentient creatures. At first horror was the rational thought to such a disease of the soul, but eventually through giving in, you have discovered that having such a appalling diet mends your wounds and increases your prowess. However, feasting on such a disgusting meal isn’t without its drawbacks. For if you indulge too hastily in your graveyard banquet, you can lose yourself and turn into loathsome Ghoul, doomed to attack friends and foes alike.
The Unholy Warrior: A wandering and corrupt soul who beacons for the favours of evil spirits and demons to grant him boons on his quest. Going through the world for self-gain, or in the service of a dark master, the Unholy Warrior leaves a trail of destruction in his wake as he punishes the innocent and the guilty alike. Do the work of vile gods and demons as you teach the world the meaning of fear.

160512.name: Forsaken Magic
160512.description:
From publisher blurb:

Forsaken Magic contains four playbooks of player classes for Dungeon World that has gorgeous cover art done by Nick Ladd. This pack features casters that utilize forces strange and uncommon as they are distrusted and feared so you can bring the outlandish and the wonderful to your games.

The Geister: A daring individual who has permitted a disembodied specter into themselves, sharing their body with the entity in exchange for being granted the utilization of the baleful powers of the departed. However, such a union of souls in a mortal body isn’t without consequences, as if the ghost is ever displeased, it will take its anger out on the unfortunate host.
The Charred: A poor individual who has been victim of an unnatural flame that has burned them strait to their soul. Your skin is covered in untreatable burns and respite from travels offers no comfort. The only solace you gain is through feeding material to your inner smouldering wound. This horrific injury of both body and soul does have a boon in the form of a strange magic that it grants to its victims. Most are unwillingly exposed to this strange curse, but some ambitious or desperate seek it out regardless of the costs.
The Fading Soul: It could be recently, or perhaps all your life you have had it, you have had seemingly holy powers of creating angelic lights and other unsettling feats. These powers have come to you without warning and until now, without explanation. Through sought wisdom or self-discovery, you have learned that these magic powers are not a gift from some higher source, but the accidental and lost art of utilizing one’s soul as fuel for magic prowess. You must carefully balance the use of these powers, for an overuse could extinguish your soul.
The Changeling: A strange and tricky offspring between an enraptured mortal and a fay captor, or a perhaps a human child who has been abducted by fay and raised as their own. By either means, you have been raised in the fairy world of glamorous magics and alien scenery. You have now traveled to the duller world of mortals that leaves you a little homesick with its mundane texture. The stories you tell of the fay world are so invigorating and enchanting that they mold the mortal realm to fit their description.

160514.name: Wummen Quartett
160514.description:
Publisher's blurb

Waffenpower!
Ob Planung, Intrigen, Infiltration: Echte Runner wissen, dass es Zeiten gibt, in denen das letzte Wort gesprochen wurde. Dann gilt nur noch, wer sich im Kampf behauptet, wer den Schusswechsel überlebt – und wer die größeren Waffen hat.
Das Wummenquartett für Shadowrun 5 mit seinen großzügigen, vierfarbigen Illustrationen enthält auf 32 Karten bekannte Waffen aus dem Shadowrun-Universum: von der kleinen Pistole bis zum großen Scharfschützengewehr. Neben der Möglichkeit, es als normales Quartett zu spielen, kannst du es dank der angegebenen Waffenwerte auch als Stechquartett nutzen – und sogar im Rollenspiel als Ausrüstungskarten verwenden.
Inklusive eines Freischalt-Codes für Shadowrun Online, der einen exklusiven Ausrüstungsgegenstand verfügbar macht.


User description

Shadowrun Wummen Quartett is a set of 32 cards depicting various weapons of the Shadowrun universe with Shadowrun5 game stats. It also includes an activation code for Shadowrun Online.

160517.description:
A wonderful weekend in a wood cabin with friends to relax, with drinks and food, a party...and blood! An evil as old as time has awoken and it is possessing you all by taking advance of your weakness. If nobody finds the book of the dead and destroys it, this will be your last night as humans.

The Possession is a game for 3 to 5 players in which time is against them. The evil is stalking you and each round the players could be possessed by it, and becoming one of the thirsty blood demons looking for living souls, the other players' souls!

At the beginning of a round, all players roll a die: the more wounds you have, the more easily you become a possessed. Then players play an action card to indicate how many actions they can play and how much they risk suffering an evil event. This risk is higher in the cards that give more actions.

When a player finds enough pages from the book of the dead and burns them in an altar, before the evil owns all players, he becomes the winner. By using the action points, players can cover the house looking for the pages as well as objects, weapons, and keys to get into the basement and attic-; they can also rest in order to get back the action cards played and heal wounds to keep alive.

A possessed player must attack his friends so that the evil inside him feeds of his crime and not with his soul. He will be able to smash doors, escape for windows to get inside in other rooms and so, surprise another players. He will have more action points depending on his possessing level.

The other players can attack the possessed ones. The only way to stop them is dismembering them completely — but these amputated members will be wandering around ready to claw and strangle whoever gets close enough...
160517.name: The Possession

160519.description:
TV series adaption
Objective: be the first completing a set of
ingredients/tools to achieve a master degree regarding witchcraft.
- moving by turns -
Move around the board according dice roll collecting the stuff you need (depending on the space you end your turn). There are 3 different sort of spaces: sorcery, character and chance. To increase your abilities you must find matching combinations.
160519.name: Sabrina L'Apprentie Sorciere

160520.name: The Elementalist
160520.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Elementalist is a magician who specializes in controlling the elements. An alternative take on the wizard, instead of spells, the Elementalist has control over a set number of elements, and may command them in a set number of ways—both of which increase as they level up. The Elementalist also appears in DW2: Island of Fire Mountain.

160522.name: New Star Soccer 5
160522.description:
New Star Soccer 5 is a game where you start out as a 16 year old lad and try to become a football legend. It combines a 2D match engine with a career mode. You need to train hard, play matches, make transfers, do interviews, stay in touch with friends, sign sponsorship deals, go to the casino, buy items, cars, horses, property, a private jet... The list goes on!

Source: The Developer Website.

160523.name: Chill (Supers! Revised)
160523.description:
From publisher blurb:

Justice Wheels 2 for SUPERS! (Revised Edition) features Chill, a cold-powered superhuman (in the style of Mr. Freeze) who's ready for action at your gaming table - either as a villain or vigilante.

This pdf contains stats, background and art for Chill and her signature Ice Bike.

But that's not all! Since SUPERS! now has both vehicle combat and miniature rules - this pdf comes with nifty paper miniatures of both Chill and her motorcyce.

160524.name: Soccer Blast Pro Soccer Game
160524.description:
SOCCER BLAST is designed to bridge the gap between highly detailed soccer games that play in the 90-120 minute range and quick-play games which are primarily designed to generate realistic scores. PLAAY Games has taken the basic game engine from its hockey and lacrosse games, and modified it to capture the more refined nuances of classic football. The result: a sports board game that gives fans everything they love about watching soccer, captured in a 30-45 minute game window.

Despite the quick playing time, SOCCER BLAST provides surprising detail and the genuine sense of witnessing a full, realistic football match from start to finish. Individual players' true-to-life abilities are captured simply but realistically, using a series of easy-to-understand symbols and descriptive qualities. These individual performances synch together to create realistic team results that will make you feel like you're in the stands watching the game for real!

SOCCER BLAST was created in such a way as to place an emphasis on story and context. Yes, the statistics are important, and we think you'll be pleased with the numerical results. However, this game is more than just numbers. The usual assortment of drama-inducing elements and game mechanics that PLAAY Games have become known for have been built into this game as well. For example, referees can affect play--and BE affected by play. If somebody says the wrong thing to a ref, his team might have to pay for it. In SOCCER BLAST, you'll occasionally see a subjective referee call that should have gone the other way, and you'll experience that palpable sense of joy, or disgust, depending on your leaning!

The game offers many other features. The advantage of playing on one's home pitch is very real, but not over-stated. Injuries will play a factor, and you may be chagrined to see your star player carted off the field with the match hanging in the balance. Fatigue is a factor, too--you'll face the same challenge with late-game substitutions that a real soccer coach faces, and you'll need to plan accordingly. And, the game comes with a full complement of unusual and rare results waiting to add memorable twists to your tabletop sports archives.

Finally, SOCCER BLAST Pro Soccer Game allows you to rate your own teams with its "How-To" guide, made available at a nominal extra charge. The world is filled with soccer teams and every country has its own league or leagues. Ordinarily, this poses a problem for game companies because while many of these leagues have devoted fan followings, they're not large enough to warrant the time and energy of creating cards for them. If you have your OWN favorite team or league, you won't have to depend on PLAAY Games to make cards for you—you'll be able to make them yourself!

160525.name: New Star Soccer 4
160525.description:
New Star Soccer 4 is a football career game where you can be the best player in the world. Start out at a premier team or in the lower leagues, then prove yourself on the pitch and off it. Build your skills in the training mini-games and grab the headlines on match day. You will also need to manage your relationships with friends, the media, girlfriend and more. If your personal life suffers so will your performance, and the choices you make will ultimately determine your success.

Source: The Developer Website.

160526.description:
The undead hordes are back! And this time they come in all shapes and sizes. Crawlers will sneak up on you. Runners are first seen in the distance, but before you know it they are right in front of you. And Brutes aren't any faster than your standard Walker, but boy, are they hard to kill.

Tired of just killing Walkers? Well, with Run, Fight, or Die! Zombie Horde Expansion now you have an assortment of zombies for Run, Fight, or Die! And to compensate for the game now being harder, each player can choose to have either a new skill or more Health Points.

Good luck, and may the best players...live to die another day.
160526.name: Run, Fight, or Die! Zombie Horde Expansion

boardgameaccessory.172743: Run, Fight, or Die!: Big Box

160527.description: The undead hordes are back... to eat the brains of more players! Run, Fight, or Die! 5/6 Player Expansion adds two action boards, two character boards, and twenty walkers, allowing up to six players to join your game of Run Fight or Die! This expansion comes in an extra large box so that you can store all the goodies from other expansions in one place.
160527.name: Run, Fight, or Die! 5/6 Player Expansion

boardgameaccessory.172743: Run, Fight, or Die!: Big Box

160528.name: Gun City
160528.description:
User Summary
Gun City is a game made for Commodore 64 in 1992. The game is a shooter with western theme. The player control a gunsight trying to shoot men in doors and windows in a western town. The screen is standing still, while the men are moving. To complete a level the player need to shoot 20 men.

160531.name: Hercules - Slayer of the Damned
160531.description:
User Summary
Hercules - Slayer of the Damned is a hack'n slash game from Gremlin Graphics. You play as Hercules and need to collect 12 objects, "Labours", an then beat the minotaur to win the game. The objects is falling from the sky, and to collect a object Hercules need to smash them with his club. Meanwhile Hercules is attacked by skeletons. The screens does not scroll, and the skeletons attack one by one, and Hercules can only hit enemies while standing above the snake that is crawling at the bottom of the screen.

160532.name: Value Pack (48K Spectrum)
160532.description:
User Summary

Beau-Jolly made their name in the music business by selling compilations. In the mid 1980s they were looking to do the same thing with video games. One of the companies they approached was Imagine. After their spectacular and public collapse, Beau-Jolly ended up owning Imagine's back-catalogue.

The Value Pack compilations released by Beau-Jolly contained mostly Imagine games. Some were duplicated across different platforms, but no two compilations were the same, though they shared the same artwork.

The 48K ZX Spectrum version consisted of:

Cosmic Cruiser - A shooter where you use a cannon to attack an alien spacecraft and save the crewmen released.
B.C. Bill - An arcade game where the aim is for a caveman to use his club to hunt food, defend against predators and 'collect' wives!
Pedro - An arcade maze game where a Mexican gardener is fighting to protect his plants against various animals.
ZZoom - An aircraft shooter with a 3D viewpoint.
Zip-Zap - An arcade game where a robot on a far-off planet is fighting against hordes of aliens.
Alchemist - An arcade-adventure where the player is aiming to collect four pieces of a scroll to defeat an evil warlock.

160533.name: Value Pack (16K Spectrum)
160533.description:
User Summary

Beau-Jolly made their name in the music business by selling compilations. In the mid 1980s they were looking to do the same thing with video games. One of the companies they approached was Imagine. After their spectacular and public collapse, Beau-Jolly ended up owning Imagine's back-catalogue.

The Value Pack compilations released by Beau-Jolly contained mostly Imagine games. Some were duplicated across different platforms, but no two compilations were the same, though they shared the same artwork.

The 16K ZX Spectrum version consisted of:

Arcadia - A Gorf / Galaxians style shoot 'em up.
Ah Diddums - A teddy bear needs to escape from a toy box to comfort his crying baby owner
Molar Maul - The player is controlling a toothbrush fighting against bacteria in a mouth.
Jumping Jack - A platform game where the player has to guide Jack to the top of the screen by jumping through holes.

160534.name: Value Pack (Commodore 64)
160534.description:
User Summary

Beau-Jolly made their name in the music business by selling compilations. In the mid 1980s they were looking to do the same thing with video games. One of the companies they approached was Imagine. After their spectacular and public collapse, Beau-Jolly ended up owning Imagine's back-catalogue.

The Value Pack compilations released by Beau-Jolly contained mostly Imagine games (the Commodore versions also included two Livewire games each). Some games were duplicated across different platforms, but no two compilations were the same, though they shared the same artwork.

The Commodore 64 version consisted of:

Arcadia - A Gorf / Galaxians style shoot 'em up.
Pedro - An arcade maze game where a Mexican gardener is fighting to protect his plants against various animals.
Cosmic Cruiser - A shooter where you use a cannon to attack an alien spacecraft and save the crewmen released.
B.C. Bill - An arcade game where the aim is for a caveman to use his club to hunt food, defend against predators and 'collect' wives!
Invaders - A Space Invaders clone.
3D Jumpin Jack - A Frogger clone presented in a pseudo-3D isometric perspective.

160535.name: Value Pack (Commodore Vic 20)
160535.description:
User Summary

Beau-Jolly made their name in the music business by selling compilations. In the mid 1980s they were looking to do the same thing with video games. One of the companies they approached was Imagine. After their spectacular and public collapse, Beau-Jolly ended up owning Imagine's back-catalogue.

The Value Pack compilations released by Beau-Jolly contained mostly Imagine games (the Commodore versions also included two Livewire games each). Some games were duplicated across different platforms, but no two compilations were the same, though they shared the same artwork.

The Commodore Vic 20 version consisted of:

Wacky Waiters - A platformer where the player needs to negotiate a series of lifts to take drinks to customers.
Arcadia - A Gorf / Galaxians style shoot 'em up.
Catcha Snatcha - You play a store detective chasing after shoplifters and returning lost property.
Bewitched - A disembodied key needs to navigate a maze opening doors while avoiding ghosts and ghouls.
Invaders - A Space Invaders clone.
3D Jumpin Jack - A Frogger clone (despite the name on the packaging, this is not a 3D version of the game.

160536.name: Fairy Tale
160536.description:
User Summary
This game is an implementation of the physical card game of the same name. Play in novice mode is free, unlocking the "expert rules" is available as an in-app-purchase.

160537.name: Code Monkey Island
160537.description:
Code Monkey Island is a family-friendly board game that introduces kids ages 8 and up to programming concepts used by real programmers. Code Monkey Island is a board game designed for families. It takes about a minute to learn the rules and 45 minutes to play, and exposes kids to fundamental programming concepts like control structures, data structures, Boolean logic and operators, and assignment and mathematical operations.

Step 1: Each player chooses their favorite tribe of monkeys, and sets them down in the corresponding Start Circle.
Step 2: Everyone is dealt 3 Rule cards.
Step 3: On their turn, a player draws 1 Rule card, and plays another card from their hand to move their monkeys forward.
Step 4: The first player to get all 3 of their monkeys around the island and into the banana grove wins!

rpgissuearticle.120377: 101 Not So Random Encounters: Forest Kingdom

160540.name: The Entropy System Game of Heroes
160540.description:
From Introduction:

The Game of Heroes is a heroic role playing game written to be played with the Entropy System rules.

160541.name: Paw Patrol Adventure Game
160541.description: Paw Patrol Adventure Game is a simple race-to-the-finish path game for young children. Based on the Paw Patrol television series, players take control of one of six different pups and use the spinner to move along the path. Spinning a color allows you to move to the next available space of that color and collect a badge of that color. You can use the badge to take shortcuts further along the path. Whoever reaches the end of the path first wins the game.

160542.name: Spirit Stones
160542.description:
User Summary
Spirit Stones is a free-to-play mobile game with a mixture of card collection, RPG and match-3 elements. You collect cards that represent characters from different classes and use them to fight monsters by connecting 3 or more coloured bubbles. Each bubble colour represents another character class and enhances this classes damage.

You can fight together with your friends to defeat Hellbosses, very tough monsters that can only be defeated in cooperation. Or you can fight your friends in PVP style for emblems, that you can trade in for better and stronger cards.

160544.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Bunnings, a company in Australia.
160544.name: Monopoly: Bunnings Warehouse 2007 Edition

160545.name: Crazier Eights
160545.description:
A shedding card game. Players take turns drawing a card, discarding a card, and playing a card for an effect. The first player with zero cards wins.

Unlike the original Crazy Eights game, every card can have a unique effect on the game.

The characters and card effects incorporate fantasy elements, such as a Dragon card and a Death card (which destroys characters and castles).

160546.name: Swing
160546.description:
Swing is a crazy party card game for 3-8 mature players, published in 2014 by the Polish company Let's Play.

In the game, described by the publisher as "mental Kamasutra", the players' aim is to collect 30 Pleasure Points. They earn them by using Sex Positions cards (Actions, Counter-actions, Events and Special cards) to initiate a "virtual" intercourse with another player's character (they can be of different sexes and orientation). Other players can interrupt and prevent earning points by playing Counter-action cards, often with a humorous effect.

For adults only!

160547.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Geelong Cats, an Australian Footballcub;limited Edition to raise money for McGuinness McDermott Foundation (now Little Heroes Foundation).
160547.name: Monopoly: Geelong Football Club 2007 Premiership Charity Edition

160549.name: Perfect Match
160549.description:
The match box was dropped and all the matches are mixed up. The goal of the game is to find as many matching pairs as possible. The game plays similar to the classic memory game Concentration, but there are a few twists.

Half of the cards will be face down and the rest will be face up. The start player will lay down the cards in a 3x3 grid. Each player should look at the cards as they are being put down, as it is important to remember the cards & placement. Just like in the classic memory game, the players try to find a matching pair. Whoever says "match!" gets a try. When the cards match, that player takes the cards, which will score at the end of the game. If 2 different cards are picked, these go to the discard pile and the player receives one of the yellow burning matches. If no one else sees another match, the remaining cards are reshuffled and the next player places them in the grid.

The game ends when all cards have been claimed, or if the 5 burning matches are in play. The player with the most cards wins.

167458.name: GodZ: the Genesis of Badly Dead

160550.description:
A new world is about to arise. A horde of GodZ are battling to be the most powerful deity of the pantheon: Will you play the role of Tud, God of Mountains, Mud and Ugly Snouts? Or will you dwell in the ocean bottom with Glu, God of the Sea, of Fried Fish and of Octoguys? Whichever god you are going to incarnate, you will lay the foundations of your brand new cult, creating life, building temples and guiding your mighty Avatar amongst mortals. Lead your followers in epic, god-sized battles, and become the most powerful of the GodZ!

In GodZ, players take control of one of the deities of the world of Super Fantasy: Ugly Snouts Assault. The game takes place on a modular, hexed board that is built up by players as the game proceeds. Victory can be achieved in different ways: controlling regions, conquering cities, fighting, building, or being adored by huge amounts of followers.

The heart of the game is the action system, based on a mechanism that allows players to perform miracles and actions, and even to directly score points, choosing their priorities carefully each turn: the more powerful their actions, the fewer points they will score when their followers pray.
160550.name: GodZ

160551.name: De weg naar Kralingen
160551.description:
The goal is to get to "De Admiraal", the municipality building with the least amount of dimes.

Everybody receives a start fund of 5 dimes to play with. If the bank is empty, it means everybody is out of luck until somebody needs to pay taxes again.

The unfortunate one who is broke can beg for money with the "rich" people. If that doesn't happen he or she needs to return a minimum of 15 blocks to a white space.

The game is influenced by a dice, chance cards challenges, tact, charm and experience.

160552.name: No Shame Charades
160552.description:
No Shame Charades is the unclassy twist to the classic party game. Perfect for social adults with an unfiltered sense of humor.

The game comes with a 2 minute sand timer, 20 Game Changer cards and 480 phrase cards, each with it's own hilarious definition to help the one person that doesn't know what a "Rusty Trombone" is.

Phrases derive from 4 main topic areas:
- today's pop culture(ish) (ex. "Anchorman", tiger blood, bath salts)
- dark matter (crack baby, kidnap)
- adult stuff (dry hump, walk of shame, morningwood)
- general funny (brain fart, "sh*t hit the fan", explosive diarrhea)

There are 4 types of Game Changer cards - lose a turn, all play, charade with a beverage in one hand, and reverse the timer.

Each team takes 2 minute turns to act out as many phrase cards possible. For every phrase correctly guessed, your team earns 1 point. If a card is passed, you lose a point. At the end of each round, the other teams can earn a point by taking 1 correct guess at a card that was passed during the round. Watch out for Game Changers - these cards will make you wish you\'ve never been born. First team to 21 wins!

160553.name: Tower of the Ogre Mage
160553.description:
From the Introduction:

One of the Archmage’s hidden towers is threatened by an advancing orc army.

This adventure is ideal for characters as a prelude to Wrath of the Orc Lord, Elf Queen’s Enchantment or The Dwarf Lord’s Domain. It also links neatly with the 2nd level adventure The Lich King’s Crown.

The Ogre Mage’s Tower is a traditional dungeoncrawl adventure. The characters are there to kill monsters and secure the treasure. Characters aligned with the Archmage will want to return control of the tower to him, characters with a negative relationship with the Archmage might be there to take his stuff. There are ideas on how to integrate icon relationships with the adventure at the start of session 1.

The adventure starts in media res with the adventurers already at the front door of the tower. To bring the group of players together and provide a framing device for the story start with a montage.

160554.name: Charm City Blues
160554.description:
We stand staring at the chalk outline on the wet sidewalk.
“Five bucks says it’s Tanos,” Robertson says.
I toss my cigarette to the ground, grind it down the the toe of my shoe.
“Five bucks it is.”

---

Charm City Blues is my love letter to the crime noir genre. As members of the elite Vice Squad, you'll be traveling around Charm City in an attempt to build a case and catch your Suspect before the end of the Plot. Charm City Blues is completely cooperative with each player having a personal Vice that effects the way you play the game.

Charm City Blues is played on a 5x4 grid of cards laid out in numerical order to create Charm City. At the start of the game players will choose a Difficulty and Suspect and deal 12 cards from the Plot deck. Then, roll the d20 Clue die 4 times to spawn Clues on the Location cards with the corresponding number. The goal of the game is to build a case and catch the Suspect by filling up the Difficulty and Suspect cards with clues before the Plot deck runs out.

Each round of Charm City Blues is divided into two phases, the Plot phase and the Investigation phase. During the Plot phase the player with the Commissioner token flips the top card of the Plot deck. This card gives a narrative cue which the Commissioner will expand on in telling a few lines of story about the game so far. Then, each player will have a chance to gain clues during their Investigation.

Each player has four abilities: Fight, Arrest, Research, and Interrogate. During your investigations you will test these abilities by rolling the number of d6 listed next to your Ability and trying to match or beat the number required on the Location card. If you succeed, you move the Clue up to the Difficulty or Suspect card and gain some cold hard cash. If you fail, you lose Hit Points or gain Suspicion Points. Lose too many Hit Points or gain too may Suspicion Points and the game is over.

160555.name: High Stakes
160555.description:
User Summary

"High Stakes" is a Text Adventure game with an advanced multi-word parser. It has real-time gameplay where things happen even if you don't do anything. The original novel this game is based on was first published in 1975 and written by Dick Francis.

From the Back of the Box

You are Steven Scott, English gentleman, self-made millionaire, creator and designer of the world famous Rola toys. You have a flashy Lamborghini, a winning racehorse, and a big problem. Jody Leads, the trainer of your horses, has been robbing you blind. It seems simple just to fire him. But things are seldom as they seem...
You are about to face the longest odds of your life. Plunged into danger, you have to untangle the web of deceit and violence that threatens all you have- your horse, your honor, and your life. All it will take is quick thinking, a lot of luck, and the help of a beautiful stranger and a trusted friend. Watch yourself, Steven, time's running out. This time you're playing for High Stakes and if you're not careful, you'll lose it all!

160556.description:
“You will never find a more wretched hive of scum and villainy.”
–Obi-Wan Kenobi, Star Wars: A New Hope

Escape watchful eyes in Between the Shadows, the third deluxe expansion for Star Wars: The Card Game! This expansion features twenty-six new objective sets (two copies each of twelve objective sets, and one copy each of two “Limit 1 per objective deck” sets), focusing on the Jedi and Scum and Villainy affiliations. The Scum and Villainy use the shadows to pursue illicit operations and illegal dealings, while the Jedi stay hidden to escape the persecution of the Empire. Both affiliations have profited from the shadows, and in this expansion, you’ll gain access to their new strengths.

This expansion highlights the Jedi and Scum and Villainy affiliation, allowing you to play iconic characters and starships from the Star Wars universe, including Obi-Wan Kenobi, Luke Skywalker, Boba Fett, and Virago. Whether you train in the Force on the planet Dagobah, or oversee the rise of the Black Sun crime syndicate, you’ll find plenty of cards to expand your decks in Between the Shadows!
160556.name: Star Wars: The Card Game – Between The Shadows

160557.name: Live-Rollenspiel
160557.description:
User description

LiveRollenspiel is a universial set of rules and essays on LARP that gives new and advanced players and GMs all the tools they need to run their own LARP.

160559.description:
Simurgh is a game for 2-5 players who become heads of powerful clans in a fantastical world where humans and dragons live, hunt and go to wars together. As a head of a powerful family, each player will breed mighty dragons, make use of their special abilities, gather resources and try to make their house the most powerful by gathering the most Power Points. The game is played in a sequence of turns, with each turn allowing a player to perform 1 Main Action and any number of Free Actions. As a Main Action, a player will usually place a worker on an Action Space.

The workers (collectively known as Vassals) come in two types: Spearmen – young warriors of each house, and Dragonriders – noble warriors and hunters gifted with their own Simurgh steed. On their turn, each player will place one of their Vassals on an empty Action Space to gain resources, exchange their assets for Power Points, add new Vassals to their house or breed a new type of Simurgh.

During the game, players will collectively build the board by drawing and placing Action Tiles, each either providing new Action Spaces (some allowing any Vassals, some exclusively the Dragonriders), or creating an opportunity to score points for combinations of specific dragons in a player’s possession. When all the scoring spaces are filled with tiles, the game ends at the end of the round and Power Points are tallied.
160559.name: Simurgh

160560.description:
Leagues of Adventure: Rocket Race is a non-collectible steampunk card game for 2-6 players and is a game of Victorian Scientific Research, Ground-breaking Engineering, Financial Acumen, Heroic Endeavors, and a Dash of Luck.

The game pits players against each other who play Victorian Clubs or Leagues racing to complete mad-capped moon rockets and be the first to successfully land on the moon!

In the standard rules each turn players compete by bidding to obtain rocket components and they must have at least 1 propulsion system, 1 capsule and 1 steering mechanism before they can launch a rocket. Each of the components has a reliability score and by rolling 2d6 and getting a result equal to or lower than the combined reliability total means your rocket has successfully landed on the moon and you win the game!

There are also addtional rocket accessories which improves a rockets reliability. The game also includes advanced play rules which replace the bidding mechanic with a scientific research resource management system.
160560.name: Leagues of Adventure: Rocket Race

160561.description:
The palace and gardens of Versailles, finalized under the rule of Louis XIV of France, are an architectural marvel of the world. In Versailles, players take the roles of architects and interior designers, working together to build and decorate the ensemble of Versailles, competing for the favor of the King. Players take turns moving one worker from a building site to an adjacent one, activating all the workers in the new location.

Despite simple rules, players develop complex strategies, gathering resources, building the puzzle-like palace, designing impressive decorations and learning new skills, all while waiting for the arrival of his Majesty.
160561.name: Versailles

160562.name: Quick Joust
160562.description:
QUICK JOUST

Quick Joust is a fast 1 to 6-player Jousting card game where your knight faces off against another knight, trying to either unhorse him and win the match outright or win by breaking three lances.

The cards represent the Knights, list, the shields and the movement of the lance! You setup the game by creating the list and as you race down the list you must react to your opponent shield movement and readjust your lance tip with a HARD or FINE PULL to compensate for the movement. As you reach the point of contact your final lance tip location will determine whether you unhorse your opponent, break your lance, or miss all together!

At the end of the run you can earn points which will add up to decide the Tournament Champion!

1 point for shield contact!
5 points for a broken lance!
10 points for unhorsing your opponent!

Play time: 20 Minutes plus "Will be much longer if played with 2 or more players!"

Total card count: 92 cards - which includes the Knight Status cards

[2] Playing tokens.

160563.name: Max: The Curse of Brotherhood
160563.description:
User Summary
Xbox Store: Max: The Curse of Brotherhood is a classic action-adventure. It is basically a platformer full of puzzles. Max must start on a quest to save his brother. His brother is kidnapped to a hostile world. Max only chance to succeed is to use the powers of his marker to manipulate the environment and to stay courageous. Unleash the many powers of the Marker and beat the evil kidnapper!

160565.name: Kwik Snax
160565.description:
Rear cover (Amstrad Version):

"Dizzy to the rescue! Outwit Zaks' court jesters, bumble bees, clockwork mice and more in the Land of Personality. Mega features and fantastic fun in the incredibly playable, action packed, arcade puzzle game!"

Kwik Snax was later changed to "Kwick Snax" for legal reasons.

Source: Wikipedia, "Kwik Snax", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

160566.name: Strange Planet
160566.description:
A science vessel lands un an unexplored planet and a group of scientists sets out from the ship to gather data on the planet's history and wildlife, also encountering hostile aliens!

It will be up to you, as one of the science team members, whether to take the chance to collect more Data in the dangerous alien wilds, return to your Ship with the Data you've already collected, or strike out on your own to hunt the Aliens before they hunt you!

Also, when you return to the Ship, afraid to explore further, you can continue to be involved in the Mission by "analyzing" the data you've collected, using it to "bet" on the continuing Mission.

At the end of the game, after five Missions, players compare their Data totals, and the player with the most Data wins.

Strange Planet is a push-your-luck card game with elements of betting and set collection.

178253.name: BANG!: The Walking Dead – Lucille & Katana

160567.description:
BANG!: The Walking Dead is a shoot 'em up card game based on BANG! in which factions from The Walking Dead face off in a battle to survive. Each player becomes a famous Walking Dead character while taking on the roles of Leader, Savior, Survivor, or Loner.


The Leader of the survivors is revealed to all and attempts to protect everyone while staying alive.



Saviors, who hide their identities, aim to kill the Leader of the survivors.



Survivors, who also go incognito, aid the Leader in staying alive.



The Loner, who is of course working alone, tries to defeat everyone else while accomplishing his own objective.


BANG!: The Walking Dead is interchangeable with the original BANG! game and plays much the same way. Players try to determine who is on which teams, then use their cards in hand to attack others and heal themselves, ideally ending up with their team on top.
160567.name: BANG!: The Walking Dead

160568.description:
Roll with the punches!
There's a rowdy ruckus in the land of Leprechauns.
Perhaps it's their penchant for porter, or maybe it's because they're giddy for gold. Either way, it's time to play. Pick up your Shillelagh and join in the frey.

Leprechaun is an all out battle for gold. It's a dice rolling game with a bit of press your luck. Players represent Leprechauns gathering gold coins, fighting over gold coins, and bolstering by drinking beer and gathering 4 leaf clovers.

Play consists of drawing 3 dice from the bag, choosing an action showing on the dice and then deciding if they wish to press their "luck of the Irish" by drawing additional dice from the bag, or they may bank what they have already acquired.

Gather, Fight or Bolster your way to the most gold to win.
160568.name: Leprechauns

160569.name: Three Card Monte
160569.description:
A quickfire card game based on the classic confidence trick. Keep your ACE hidden while you knock out opponents by guessing theirs.

Each player has three cards on the table placed face down. One ACE card and two DECOY cards. If your ACE card is taken by an opponent you are eliminated. If your opponent guesses a DECOY card then they are eliminated.

Each player has three cards in their hand. Everyone starts with a LOOK and a GUESS card as well as a third card drawn from the deck. Each turn you play only one card. If you choose to LOOK at an opponent's card this turn you will have to wait until your next turn to make a GUESS. Maybe they will use their next turn to try and knock you out, or play a SHUFFLE or BLOCK card to keep their ACE safe.

160570.name: Vossberg Superfortress
160570.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Yeah, I used to be a con. Multi-Lifer too. Now I'm a wall guard, and some of my best friends used to be CO's. The Voz may have been prison before the dead started getting back up, but now it's a fortress, and our home.-Paul "Lightning" Jasper, Prisoner 32574

A Year of the Zombie/Vossberg SuperMax crossover, Vossberg Superfortress details the changes made to life inside a Supermax Prison when there is no more room in Hell and the dead walk the earth.

Detailed inside is the changes to population, the various factions inside the walls, services and goods available to travellers, and how things came to pass.

This Product is rated M for violence, profanity, and other unsavory topics.

Requires NO other supplements beyond Year of the Zombie and Modern d20.

160571.name: Bridge-It
160571.description:
Bridge-It was one of the first games produced for the Amstrad CPC to coincide with the system's release in 1984. Published by Amsoft, it was one of 50 launch titles produced to be sold at the same time as the CPC464. In the game, you take control of an unnamed character that must cross bridges, which can be raised and lowered, in order to get from his house to the other end of the town.

Later on, Amstrad gave this game away free with all new Amstrad CPC computers sold as part of a ten-game software bundle.

Source: Wikipedia, "Bridge-It", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

160572.description:
It’s a well-worn story by now in the Land of Danger: An army attacking a castle. Somehow, though, the story keeps happening, and another bellicose mob has advanced on the imposing walls of someone else’s keep. The clash to control those walls is at hand. Lead the Blue attackers or the Red defenders, using clever card play and a touch of luck to control more sections of the wall than your opponent

The game consists of 54 cards -- 5 walls, a Red personal deck of 8 cards, a Blue personal deck of 8 cards, and a main deck of 33 cards.

Players take turns playing Archer, Cannon, Attack, Leader and Flag cards from their hands to the different walls. Archers & Cannons each have a strength value, and the player with the most total strength at a wall controls it. Attacks remove the opponent's cards, Leaders each have a unique ability that impacts how strength is calculated at a wall, and Flags lock down the control of a wall and trigger the end game.

The player controlling the most walls at the end of the game is the winner.
160572.name: Danger at the Walls

160573.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Adelaide Crows, an Australian Footballcub; limited 20th Anniversary Edition to raise money for McGuinness McDermott Foundation (now Little Heroes Foundation).
Not to be confused with Monopoly: Adelaide Crows
160573.name: Monopoly: 20 Years of Adelaide Crows

160574.name: Monopoly: Victorian Charity Edition
160574.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Victoria, a state in the south-east of Australia; limited Edition to improve the lives of children and young people throughout Victoria.

160575.name: #30 Mercenary Companies
160575.description:
From publisher blurb:

We aren’t mean, we just get paid to do mean things!

Within #30 Mercenary Companies are more honorable, professional, and/or ruthless free companies than an a would be conquer can shake a king’s ransom at!

Need an to stop those pesky white dragon mounted frost giants? You can hire the Wings Over Water free company, if your goals are to their tastes.

Need to stop a particularly powerful ship, convince the Skullreapers that it’s a pirate ship and you might not even have to pay them yourself. Of course, if you lied about them being pirates they might decide you are one instead.

If you have a tactical mind, a grasping nature, or you are not someone to get your own hands dirty, then I am sure that we have a company to interest you!

For use with the Mass Combat system from the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game: Ultimate Campaign.

Enjoy #30 Mercenary Companies today!

160576.name: Prayer's Point
160576.description:
From publisher blurb:

The quaint village of Prayer’s Point is a prosperous place. Many folk believe it is blessed by the gods, for numerous aasimar children are born to its residents and visitors alike. As if the villagers needed additional confirmation their home is touched by divinity, the nearby river of Angel’s Run and the bay it feeds are famous for their waters, which shine with golden light each sunrise and sunset. Still, even such a tranquil place as Prayer’s Point isn’t without its problems. Whispered rumours speak of lycanthropes in the nearby forest, ghosts stalking the village’s graveyard and of strange, rotting carcasses floating down Angel’s Run. And looming above all hangs the horrible truth: terrible, unnatural things craving nothing more than wanton death lurk within nearby Mount Hoarfrost.

This product is a Dual Format PDF. The downloadable ZIP file contains two versions, one optimised for printing and use on a normal computer and one optimised for use on a mobile device such as an iPad.

160577.name: River Boat
160577.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible vehicle. The vehicle introduced in this installment of the series is a primitive TL4 cargo river boat.

The PDF contains the background of the vehicle and statistics for its use as well as an illustration.

160578.name: Relay Station Zero
160578.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a full-color, 40 inch by 40 inch, floor plan of a SciFi Relay Station, with Hex, Square and No overlay.

The PDF includes includes the VTT (Virtual Table Top Images for online play), and a 360 degree view from the center of the map.

“Zero? Can you hear us Zero?”

[Static]

Whether you need a small expansion colony or a communication or sensor research facility, DramaScape has your location with Relay Station Zero!

Relay Station Zero includes the exterior surroundings of a small colony or research station of a planet and the interiors of two buildings with the roofs cut off, the relay station and the residential building.

Relay Station Zero is intended for use in near or far future science fiction games.

Adventure hook(s) for use with this product.

Last Transmission: Relay Station Zero’s last communication was twenty-four hours ago. Since then, there has been dead silence. Fearing the worst, the Player Characters are recruited for a possible search and rescue operation. What the Player Characters find when they arrive is up to the Game Master. The crew has either been captured or killed so that they cannot perform their duties or the communication system has been sabotaged or destroyed so that it no longer functions.

An Extra Relay Lap: Someone on Relay Station Zero is relaying messages to an unknown organization. The Player Characters are recruited for a counterespionage mission to inspect the facility and root out the traitor. When the Player Characters stay far too long for a routine inspection, the spy infiltrates the relay station to message for an escape shuttle, sets charges to blow up all the relays, and then attempts to flee to the evacuation point where the shuttle will land and blow the charges at a distance. The Player Characters have to capture the spy and learn the contents of the last message as well as stop the bombs from knocking out the relays.

The next day, an unknown force attacks Relay Station Zero…

160579.name: DC Universe Narrator's Screen
160579.description:
From publisher blurb:

West End Games DC Universe (West End Games) Narrator's Screen. Includes the Narrator's Guide and Narrator's Screen. The Narrator's Guide, teaches you how to become a Narrator, with optional rules, details on creating new equipment, and introductions to some of the more legendary heroes, villains, and other important people of the DC Universe.

160580.name: Stay Alive!: Lite Edition
160580.description:
From publisher blurb:

Stay Alive! (SA!) is a modern rules variant that is intended for use with the Tunnels & Trolls role-playing game. This is not a standalone game. While intended and designed for version 7.5 of the T&T rules, any edition will work as the basics are all fairly similar.

The system will work well if you are planning on running a game in a multitude of modern campaign genres. Future volumes from Darkshade Publishing will be released to offer specific campaign information along with GM or Solo adventures. This is the rules only edition.

Includes: Character Sheet, Modern Weapons Charts, Rules for Automatic Weapons, New Range Charts, Modifiers for Missile Combat, and much more.

160581.name: Lorian Darkshade's Guide to Meandering Monsters: Volume 1
160581.description:
From publisher blurb:

Meandering Monsters is a supplement for the Tunnels & Trolls role-playing system. Scenarios, monsters, articles, and other features have been designed for use with the 7.5 rules edition. Material can easily be adapted to earlier editions of T&T as well as other role-playing systems.

Featured in Volume 1

Monsters: Creeping Crawler, Hippogriff, Lizardmen of the Great Forest
GM Scenarios: A Hole in the Ground, For a Few Scales More
Plus new spells, new magic items, and game aids.

160582.name: Infectonator: Hot Chase
160582.description:
User Summary

Run as far as you can. You can grab coins to buy upgrades. Try to grab mutations to make your zombie more powerful. Grab rockets to move faster and grab treasure chests for additional bonuses. Try to grab humans to join your zombie gang and increase your infecting power and make it easier to grab items. But watch out. Humans will try to shoot you and place roadblocks and items in your way. And you have to watch out for cars. Once your run out of speed or health you will go to the menu where you can spend money on many different upgrades such as speed and health and stamina. Or you can upgrade the zombie mutations or unlock additional base zombie characters.

160583.description:
Enter a world where every decision you make will have lasting consequences. Customize the board, your faction and your strategies!

Factions has been designed to provide you with an accessible yet deep, highly customizable, tabletop wargame. You take on the role of a military leader in one of four (base game) competing Factions and will need all your planning, tactics and cunning to dominate in this deeply immersive game. The many levels of customization available in FACTIONS means the replay value is extremely high, and every game brings a new set of challenges for you to enjoy.
160583.name: Factions

160584.name: Lacrosse Blast Pro Indoor Lacrosse Game
160584.description:
Lacrosse Blast is an "old-school" card-chart-and-dice simulation of pro lacrosse. Primarily designed as a solitaire game for sports board game hobbyists, it can also be played head-to-head, with each player making decisions for his team.

From the publisher:

We've taken our original lacrosse game, Crash and Scramble, and made it even better by adapting it to the same game engine that powers our popular hockey game, Hockey Blast. The result is a fast-playing, fun board game simulation of this cutting-edge pro sport that captures everything fans love about it: bone-jarring hits, acrobatic passes, rocket-fast shots, and amazing saves. YOU can re-create all the thrilling action of this "ahead-of the curve" sport, right in your own home, with Lacrosse Blast Pro Indoor Lacrosse Game!

Lacrosse Blast uses a possession-by-possession system of play that keeps things moving fast. The game uses the same easily-memorized chart structure and no-nonsense method of rating players as our hockey game. Players perform based on the presence--or absence--of various qualities like speed, power and skill. Each player is also rated for his ability in creating and/or taking away scoring opportunities, as well as for shots and assists, penalties, face-offs and injury. That means you'll get table-top performances which echo each player's real-life abilities without a bunch of calculations or math gymnastics. You'll see the great assist guys dishing it off for goals and the powerhouse shooters firing the ball into the net, while the less-talented players defer to someone else. You'll be caught up in the action as you "watch" players use their power, skill and savvy to make plays. Goalies have their own special ratings, designed to make the real-life star net-minders shine on your table top the just way they do on the pro league floor! Easy-to-play, but amazingly detailed--THAT'S Lacrosse Blast Pro Indoor Lacrosse simulation board game!

160585.description:
Kickstarter Exclusive Means of Power Expansion

Four new special action cards that will help vary each game and give it greater replayability.
160585.name: Alliances: Means of Power Expansion

160586.description:
This set of 17 additional cards for Incredible Expeditions: Quest for Atlantis includes even more content inspired by the writings of H.P. Lovecraft. Add to the base game to bring more madness, Curses and Supernatural influence to Quest for Atlantis.

Take charge of your expedition as the academic-turned-cultist Dr. Psyrri. Enchant your Crew with the haunting violin song of the Musician. Face off against Shoggoths and Deep Ones in your quest to discover the secrets of R'lyeh.
160586.name: Incredible Expeditions: Lovecraftian Mini-Expansion

160587.name: TwoDots
160587.description:
Every day should be an adventure. So pack your bags and get ready for a new quest with two curious dots. TwoDots is a new puzzle game that's free to play.

Explore new challenges on your journey through multiple worlds. Solve challenging puzzles by connecting the dots and more.

Source: The Game Website.

160588.description:
This expansion adds 17 new cards based on the Tales of the Arabian Nights to Incredible Expeditions: Quest for Atlantis. Combine with the base game for more gorgeous clockwork devices and opportunities to backstab your opponents.

Lead your expedition as the ruthlessly creative Sandbad Al-Basrah. Pull your Crew by the purse-strings with the help of the Treasurer of Kings. Face down the legendary Roc and attack your opponents head-on with Piracy to beat them to the treasures of the legendary City of Brass.
160588.name: Incredible Expeditions: 1,001 Tales of Betrayal Mini-Expansion

160589.description:
Game description from the publisher:

The time has come to claim your prize from the Free Captains' Regatta: the supposedly uninhabited Island of Empty Eyes. The ruins prove to be a bit more inhabited — and dangerous — than they might have first appeared. In the Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Island of Empty Eyes Adventure Deck, you must tame the island, throw a rollicking feast, and gain seats on the Pirate Council.

This 110-card expansion includes new rare loot cards and five new scenarios that make up the complete "Island of Empty Eyes" adventure, along with new monsters, locations, villains, and more. Continue your character's legend with the Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Island of Empty Eyes Adventure Deck.
160589.name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Skull & Shackles Adventure Deck 4 –  Island of Empty Eyes

151007.name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Skull & Shackles – Base Set

160590.name: Zombie Invasions Basic Game
160590.description:
Zombie Invasions is a Zombie Apocalypse Survival Horror Combat System developed by Frugal Rock Games. This board game allows for 2 - 5 players to take on the role of either Survivors or the Zombie Master in a strategic turn based fight for survival.

Survivors must employ their wits and a selection of weapons in order to defeat wave after wave of shambling nightmares. Meanwhile the Zombie Master who takes control of the horde must use superior numbers and devastating attacks to bring the Survivors down at any cost.

A game or 'wave' consists of two distinct phases. The Encounter and the Post Encounter.

The game is designed to bring fun, strategic thinking and competitiveness to the table top by employing robust Action Point and Health Point systems, as well as the scoring of Earned Points which allow Survivors and the Zombie Master to buy new weapons or zombies.

Zombie Invasions is designed for consecutive games, 'waves' to be played for as long as the Survivors can live up to their name.

160591.description:
Expansion to the base game which allows the Acrobatic Cat variant to be played, as well as a standalone game using just the components of the expansion.

The standalone game is for 2 players and comprises of the stacking mechanic of the original game. The actions on the dice are different though, and there aren't any cat tokens in the game.

For playing the Acrobatic Cat variant you need the components of the original game. Apply stickers from the Plus game to the backsides of the cat tokens from the original game. The stickers contain special acrobatic actions for the cats to perform.

The cards from Cat Tower Plus can also be used to play the original game with up to 6 players.

Integrates with

Cat Tower
Cat Tower Lite
160591.name: Cat Tower Plus

160592.description:
Oklahoma Boomers takes you back to the year 1889. The Land Run of Oklahoma has just taken place, and now you and your opponent strive to get your Boomers the largest homesteads — but that can be harder than it looks!

Each player has three Boomers. On a turn, a player moves one Boomer in a straight line on the game board grid, moving it as many spaces as they wish. After this, he may use this Boomer and one of the opponent's Boomers to place cornerstones on the game board; these cornerstones are placed on the intersections where these two Boomers would meet, should they move toward one another. (If one of the Boomers couldn't reach an intersection point due to another piece being in the way, that cornerstone is not placed.)

Chains of cornerstones form borders on the game board, and at some point these borders will close off certain areas from the rest of the game board. If Boomers of only one color are in an area, this area/homestead belongs to the owner of those Boomers.

The game ends once all Boomers have their own homestead. Players receive 1 point for every square in their homesteads, and whoever has the higher score wins.

Backers on Spieleschmiede also got 4 small expansions:
- Red River
- Santa Fe
- Silberminen
- Sooner
160592.name: Oklahoma Boomers

160593.name: New Star Soccer 2010
160593.description:
User Summary

New Star Soccer 2010 is a soccer career simulation with you playing as a footballer trying to make his way up from the lower leagues to compete on the world stage. Along with playing in the actual matches, you must decide how to spend your energy between games. You can improve your skill stats via training challenges such as dribbling through cones, and you must manage your various personal and professional relationships. There is also a casino subgame allowing you to risk your wages. The game is an evolution of New Star Soccer 4 featuring a graphical overhaul and improved AI behaviour.

160594.name: New Star Soccer 3
160594.description:
New Star Soccer 3 is a football game that lets you be the star player. Take full control of your career and work your way to the top. Defender, midfielder or attacker, the choice is yours, just make sure you keep the boss, fans and everyone else happy on your rise to football stardom!

• Match engine inspired by classic football games like Kick Off and Sensible Soccer.
• Variable weather conditions. Can you handle rain, mud and even snow?
• Optional close-up cameras allow you to scrutinize the action.
• A choice of viewing angles - vertical or horizontal, plus a reverse angle during replays.
• Replays can be saved and even exported as an avi movie!
• Full player database featuring all the squads from over a 40 leagues worldwide.
• Realistic player stats that truly make each player on the pitch an individual.
• Training challenges that must be completed successfully to build your skills.

Source: The Developer Website.

160595.name: Rock of Tahamaat, Space Tyrant
160595.description:
[User summary]

In Rock of Tahamaat, Space Tyrant, one player takes on the role of the eponymous space overlord while the others attempt to end his or her reign. The tyrant is bold, decisive, energetic and ruthless. The others are craven, desperate, unlucky and vicious. Do they still have a chance to topple the tyrant?

Created by Vincent Baker, one of the pillars of the indie game movement.

160596.name: Holdfast: Record of the Dwarven Kingdoms, Volume 1
160596.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Down in the deeps of the Stormwall mountains lay vast kingdoms of worked stone, jeweled lanterns and polished axes. Gon Durul, Halsond and the Westerdeep... their proud halls are no more: their great treasuries laid bare, their warriors slain at the gates, and their crowns hidden away in Seven Helms.

Clanless though you may be, the fires of anger against those that have stolen from, shamed and injured your people burn as hot in you as in any dwarf. Now, the tale can be told of how a chance discovery in a forgotten tomb will lead you to a ruined fortress, and how, through courage, battle and cunning you will carve out a Holdfast of your people in the Deeps!


"Well, there's only one thing for it. This is a proper dwarven stronghold, even if there are no dwarves beside yourself inside its walls. Courtesy demands you announce yourself to your hosts..."

160597.name: New Star Soccer 2
160597.description:
New Star Soccer 2 expands on the original game offering more control over your life and a better match engine. This was the last game in the series to feature text-based match play and it is still popular for that reason.

Source: The Developer Website.

160598.description: The goblin bodgers’ workshop is on the verge of being overrun by a teeming mob of zombies—and now foul Stinkers have joined the ranks of the shambling dead! The stench of these vile zombies is so strong it practically glows, forcing even other zombies to keep their distance. Luckily the bodgers have a stockpile of new parts to build canny new defense contraptions. That might be just what they need to make it through the night!
160598.name: Zombies Keep Out: Night of the Noxious Dead

160599.name: Forlorn Struggles: Operations Gemse and Südwind
160599.description:
Forlorn Struggles is a DualPak game. It comes with two separate games in one package.

Operation Südwind is a two-player/solitaire game recreating the mid-February 1945 German offensive against the Soviet Bridgehead across the Garam River, in what is now southwestern Slovakia. It commenced on the morning of February 17. The German attack spearheads included a total of 44 formidable Tiger II tanks. Subsidiary attacks from across the Danube helped weaken the Soviet positions. 7th Guard Army defended stubbornly but was barely reinforced and by February 24th the Germans cleared the bridgehead. The Germans won a clear-cut operational victory but they incurred hard-to-replace losses. In the grand scheme of things Operation Südwind was a localized, and only temporary setback ,for the Soviets.

Operation Gemse is a two-player/solitaire game recreating the fierce early March German offensive in Oberlausitz and lower Siliesia against the unsuspecting Soviet 3rd Guard Tank Army commanded by General Rybalko. Securing Lauban and the surrounding area was deemed critical for a possible relief of encircled Breslau. However the planned grand encirclement anchored on Naumburg soon proved too ambitious. Instead on March 5 the Führer-Grenadier and Führer-Begleit Panzer divisions completed their reduced pincer movement and met up in Sächsisch-Haugsdorf. By March 7th, the encircled Soviet 7th Guard Tank Corps was almost completely destroyed.

160600.name: Anti-Hero
160600.description:
Anti-hero is a solitaire Print & Play game which has RPG style character development elements. The player takes on the role of a fledging superhero/villain created by a freak accident at a local nuclear facility. Your character is just getting to grips with his new skills and powers which he has acquired through the mutation of his genes.

The accident is kept quiet and your character is the only survivor. The radiation has made you smarter and more dangerous than the humans in this city. The city officials must pay for what has happened to you and your colleagues, but no one wants to hear your story, not the Police Commissioner, the District Attorney or the Mayor, but you will make them pay for what they have done.

The game uses a combination of dice to create your powers, skills gained through experience points and actions which will see the player, rob banks, hire goons, investigate and blackmail city officials. Can you take control of the city before you are stopped? You are the anti-hero.

160601.name: Justice League Strategy Game
160601.description:
Will you save the Earth or conquer it? From his stronghold on Apokolips, Darkseid is moving his forces into position, preparing to seize control of the planet! Only the Justice League stands between him and total global dominion! Will they be able to defend the planet, or will it fall to the merciless minions of Apokolips? In the Justice League Strategy Game, play as Batman, Superman, Wonder Woman, or Cyborg, each with unique powers and abilities; or as Darkseid, the nigh-unstoppable super-villain.

Utilizing a unique, card-driven system where players select the powers they wish to use without knowing what the opposition is up to, the Justice League Strategy Game comes complete with five character miniatures (with Character Sheets) featuring SwitchClix technology, plus two Custom Justice League Dice, 160 Custom Game Tokens, 86 Game Cards, and 24 Crisis Tiles.

160602.name: !Santiago y cierra, España!
160602.description:
Solo wargame on the Reconquista in the Iberian Peninsula.

The player is in charge of the Christian kingdoms that tried to recover the peninsula from Islamic control. He begins in a few regions of the north, with initial troops. Each turn he decides where to attack, places the reinforcements he receives, being able to choose which type of troops are send.
