Leaders are an important aspect of the game, and will be appearing throughout the game, and may be eliminated by combat or a natural death by old age. The IA will try to stop our progress, replacing the cities we attack, creating troops near conflict zones, which can counterattack if you do not plan your defense well. After the last turn of the game, your level of victory or defeat depends on the number of zones you've managed to reconquer.

Available as Vassal module, will be available in Print & Play as future (along this 2014), both free versions. (Rules English).


Wargame en solitario sobre la Reconquista en la península Ibérica.
Nos pondremos al mando de los reinos cristianos, que intentaran expulsar y recuperar la peninsula del control Islamico.
Comenzaremos en unas pocas regiones del norte, con unas tropas iniciales.
Cada turno deberemos de ir decidiendo donde atacar, e ir colocando los refuerzos que recibamos, pudiendo elegír en que tipo de tropas gastarlos.
Los lideres son un aspecto importante del juego, e iran apareciendo a lo largo del juego, pudiendo ser eliminados por el combate o de muerte natural por vejez.
La IA del juego irá intentando detenernos en nuestro avance, reponiendo las ciudades que ataquemos, creando tropas cerca de las zonas en conflicto, y pudiendo llegar a hacer contrataque si no eres capaz de planificar bien tu defensa.
Al acabar los turnos del juego, tu nivel de victoria o derrota dependerá del numero de zonas que has logrado reconquistar.

Disponible como modulo de Vassal, a lo largo de este 2014 estará disponible como Print & Play, ambas versiones libres.

160603.name: Dancing Dragons
160603.description:
From publisher blurb:

Scattered across the face of Exodus are the Nexus Gateways, ancient magical portals that connect with each other as well as other worlds and dimensions. They cannot be controlled completely, though—on occasion they open without warning, sometimes bringing terrifying things from across the planes. One such occasion brought the wandering hero known as the Monkey Prince, who left behind tales of his madcap adventures and a powerful weapon known as the Dancing Dragons.

The Treasure of NeoExodus: Dancing Dragons is created for use with your NeoExodus: A House Divided campaign setting home gaming for the Pathfinder RPG. The Treasures of NeoExodus series focus on creating unique and interesting magical and mundane items that you can use in your NeoExodus home games that give you more a personal connection to the item. This PDF comes with a background and history of the Dancing Dragons, its special mundane and/or magical qualities plus magic item containing detailed information and blank versions of the cards. Everything you need to incorporate Dancing Dragons into your character’s background and your gaming sessions is here making them even more appealing, special and personal.

160605.name: Hex Survival
160605.description:
Hex Survival is a tactic game of survival set in fantasy world of Moffee, where you'll have to be the last man standing.

PLOT
In order to complete his masterpiece, the perfect Zombie, Dr.Skelrt trapped Moffee's heroes in his laboratory. In order to survive, the heroes will have to fight each other and avoid zombification: only the last man (or woman, or orc, or boar) standing will earn freedom!

GAMEPLAY
Control your hero pawns and kill your adversaries while escaping their zombie version and collecting treasure cards, in a randomly-built HEXangonal map full of bonuses and maluses.
You'll have to collect treasure cards in order to attack your fellow adversaries or heal your own zombified pawns, to fire your gun, stab your opponents' back, trick, bite and infect them, and a lot more.
Being zombified hero is not the end, but just another beginning.

OBJECTIVE
Eliminate all your opponents and be the last survivor at the end of a round.

160606.description:
Day of Days: The Invasion of Normandy 1944, takes on the the first 10 days of the Normandy landings at the company level. The Allied objectives are to land successfully and push far enough off the beaches to guarantee a rapid advance into France. The Axis player needs to either defeat the initial landings or plug them up to create a stalemate.

This game is both massive and extremely playable, giving players a unique appreciation for the issues involved at the beginning of the invasion. The importance of the initial air-drops, the real potential for brutal German counterattacks, and the need to get off the beaches quickly, all these come into sharp focus within the clean and fast-playing framework of the Standard Combat Series. Players can tackle the US landings separately as single-map scenarios, the Commonwealth landings on two maps, and of course there is the Whole Enchilada.

Game Scale:
Turn: 1/2 day turns
Hex: 700 meters
Units: Platoon/Company/Battalion

Contents:

Game specific scenario/rulebook
SCS 1.7 rules
4 11" x 17" setup charts
4 22" x 34" maps
8 countersheets (2,240 1/2" counters)
2 six-sided dice




List of the 15 scenarios

Full campaigns:
Overlord Campaign (Full Campaign): 6/6 - 6/15
D+1 Campaign (After D-Day): 6/7 - 6/15
D+4 Campaign (Mid-Campaign start): 6/10 - 6/15

Mini-campaign:
Utah Beach (Map A only): 6/6 - 6/15
D+1 Utah Beach (Map A only): 6/7 - 6/15
Omaha Beach (Map B only): 6/6 - 6/15
D+1 Omaha Beach (Map B only): 6/7 - 6/15
American Beaches (Maps A & B ): 6/6 - 6/15
D+1 American Beaches (Maps A & B ): 6/7 - 6/15
Commonwealth Beaches (Maps C & D): 6/6 - 6/15
D+1 Commonwealth Beaches (Maps C & D): 6/7 - 6/15

Smaller scenarios:
Carentan (part of Map A): 6/10 - 6/13
Cutting the Contentin (part of Map A): 6/10 - 6/15
Canadian Crucible (part of Map C): 6/8 - 6/10
Villers Bocage (part of Map C): 6/13 - 6/15

(source: MMP website)
160606.name: Day of Days: The Invasion of Normandy 1944

160607.name: New Star Soccer (2003)
160607.description:
User Summary
First game in the New Star Soccer series. You are a footballer starting off your career at a lower division side. As the game progresses you attempt to work your way up the leagues to bigger and better teams. During each match the action on the pitch is presented as a running commentary, and you are required to make decisions at key points (for example: to shoot or pass). Your player's stats are affected by the outcomes and so are your relationships with teammates, your boss, the fans, etc. Between matches you are given decisions to make, each of which will help determine the path of your career.

160608.description:
In Dungeon Bazar, the player merchants try to earn money by selling equipment — weapons, armor and tools — to heroes who wish to fight against an old dragon in a nearby cave. What the heroes don't know, though, is that the merchants have an agreement with the dragon as naturally they're interested in keeping their source of gold, the great lizard, alive.

Each player has a personal game board, and each turn they play, then reveal a number of equipment cards. Each hero card displays that hero's desired equipment and priorities. Once the cards are revealed, the heroes buy from the cheapest stand according to their priorities as long as they have money.
160608.name: Dungeon Bazar

160609.description:
Infinito is an abstract game for two player with a theoretical infinite moves per turns, i.e. theoretical infinite branching factor, but with finite number of turns. A finite version of the game is Myriades.

Infinito is played on a square board, preferably 10x10 or larger. One player owns the black stones, the other player owns the white stones. Grey neutral stones are needed.

Each player has an infinite number of stones with an unique natural number printed on them: 0, 1, 2, 3, and so on...
(For practical use, you can have blank stones and write numbers on them.)

Players move alternately, starting with the player controlling the white stones. Each turn consists of two actions, performed in this order:

1. OPTIONAL MOVE: you can move a stone exactly as a Queen’s moves in Chess, i.e. any number of cells horizontally, vertically or diagonally.
If your stone ends its move (orthogonally and diagonally) next to one enemy stone whose value is less than your stone, and your stone wasn’t (orthogonally and diagonally) next to that enemy stone to start its move, replace any friendly stone – but the stone just moved – on the board with a neutral gray stone with “∞” printed on it. In one move you can end up close to more enemy stones whose value are less than your stone, in that case you replace your stones with neutral stones for each of those stones.
When you remove your stones from the board, those stones will be available for future placements.

2. COMPULSORY PLACEMENT: you must place a stone onto any empty space.

The game ends when the board is full, whoever has the least sum of his values wins.
160609.name: Infinito

160610.description:
The co-operative game Thunderbirds, released in 2015 to celebrate the 50th anniversary of the cult hit TV show, features the iconic Thunderbirds machines and a high-octane world full of disasters and victims for players to rescue.

Set in the year 2065, Thunderbirds follows the exploits of International Rescue, a secret organization committed to saving human life, secretly founded and funded by the millionaire Tracy family, with the motto: ‘Never give in, at any cost!’ International Rescue has a host of technologically advanced land-, sea-, air-, and space-rescue vehicles and equipment ready to launch at a moment’s notice.

Racing to the rescue from a secret island base beneath the luxurious home of the Tracy family somewhere in the South Pacific Ocean, International Rescue defies government spies and criminals who want the secrets of their incredible machines for their own. To combat this threat, Lady Penelope, the Thunderbirds’ aristocratic English secret agent, and her chauffeur Parker lead a network of agents to uncover those behind the disasters caused by deliberate sabotage.

A criminal mastermind known as “The Hood”, operating from a temple deep in the Malaysian jungle and in possession of strange powers, often engineers events to allow him to spy on the Thunderbird machines with the goal of selling their secrets to the highest bidder.

The iconic Thunderbirds are designed by the Tracy family’s close friend “Brains” and are assigned to each of the five Tracy brothers:
- Thunderbird 1, piloted by Scott Tracy – a hypersonic rocket plane used for fast response and rescue-zone reconnaissance, and as a mobile control base.
- Thunderbird 2, piloted by Virgil Tracy – a supersonic VTOL carrier which transports their major rescue equipment in detachable pods.
- Thunderbird 3, piloted by Alan Tracy – a single-stage, vertically launched spacecraft
- Thunderbird 4, piloted by Gordon Tracy – a utility submersible for underwater rescue, launched from Thunderbird 2
- Thunderbird 5, manned by John Tracy – a space station in geo-stationary orbit that monitors calls for help from across Earth.

Finally, Lady Penelope has the iconic FAB 1, driven by Parker – a pink, amphibious car.

Thunderbirds is a cult 1960s British science-fiction television series, created by Gerry and Sylvia Anderson. It was produced using a combination of marionette puppetry and scale-model special effects, which was dubbed “Supermarionation”. Two series, totaling thirty-two 50-minute episodes, were produced, along with two films using the same techniques.

Players will work together using Thunderbirds characters and vehicles to complete rescue missions and save the day.
160610.name: Thunderbirds

160611.name: New Star Tennis
160611.description:
New Star Tennis couples a fun and addictive game of tennis with a detailed career mode that gives you a glimpse into the life of a young tennis star. Starting out as a 16 year old newcomer to the circuit you must train hard and win tournaments around the globe as you compete on the NSG World Tour. As you earn points you will move up the ranking chart, earning cash and sponsorship deals along the way. It’s not all tennis though! To keep your spirits up you can spend time in the casino, go karting, play darts, or even buy and train race horses!

Source: The Developer Website.

160612.description:
Myriades is the little brother of the game Infinito, a game with a theoretical infinite number of moves per turn.

Myriades is a two-player game, played on a 10x10 square board.
First player own the black stones, second player the white stones. Each player has 50 stones, numbered from 0 to 49. Such numbers represents the value of the stones.

Grey stones are neutral, without value and, once placed on the board, they are immovable.

Players move alternately, starting with the player controlling the white stones. Each turn consists of two actions, performed in this order:

1. OPTIONAL MOVE: you can move a stone of your color as a Queen’s moves in Chess, i.e. any number of cells horizontally, vertically or diagonally.
If your stone ends its move (orthogonally and diagonally) next to one enemy stone whose value is less, and your stone wasn’t (orthogonally and diagonally) next to that enemy stone to start its move, replace any friendly stone – but the stone just moved – on the board with a neutral gray stone. In one move you can end up close to more enemy stones whose value are less than your stone, in that case you replace your stones with neutral stones for each of those stones.
When you remove your stones from the board, those stones will be available for future placements.

2. COMPULSORY PLACEMENT: you must place a stone onto any empty space.

The game ends when the board is full, whoever has the least sum of his values wins.
160612.name: Myriades

160614.name: Soqquadro
160614.description:
Soqquadro is an innovative party game in which what's happening away from the table is as important as what's happening on it.

The game takes place in real-time. Each player draws a card from a deck and searches for an object that satisfies the request on the card. (The cards come in three colors to identify their difficulty level.) When he finds it, he places it on the table, moves his pawn on the score path, then draws another card. When a pawn passes over a Challenge Line for the first time, the game stops for a while and a Challenge is played. The game ends when a pawn first reaches or crosses box 16 on the score path.

160615.description:
Pair of Ducks is a 2-4 player game of hidden roles. However, unlike other hidden role games, the player whose identity you don’t know is your own! Players wear their character card on their forehead.

Be the first player to get to 5 points by figuring out who you are. You can see who the other players are, and who they are affects how you play the game. For instance, if you see the Angel character, you must answer any question asked of you honestly. If you see the Ninja character card, you must not answer questions verbally (instead, use silent hand gestures and/or basic grunting). Based upon the way other players are answering questions, you should be able to figure out what character you are!
160615.name: Pair of Ducks

160616.name: Surf and Stillwell
160616.description:
Each player is the owner of a Coney Island Amusement Park in the nineteen-teens. All players start with an empty lot and $1.

In the off season, players take turning buying amusements to add to their parks. In the summer season, players visit each others parks, and pay money to go on their rides. If you land on a game stall, you play a game of chance, and maybe you get to win a prize. The different game stalls each come with their own special rules. Penny pusher involves rolling dice to see how many pennies you can get to drop.

After four years, everyone sells their depreciated rides, the money is added up. Who ever has the most money wins.

160617.description:
Cat Tower Lite is a 2 player version of the original Cat Tower game. Cats cards have to be stacked in special ways as dictated by the dice. The first player to have placed all his cards is the winner.

Cat Tower Lite has fewer cards than the original game. It also doesn't have the cat tokens of the big game. The dice is different too and has different actions for the players to perform.

The cards from Cat Tower Lite can also be used to play the original game with up to 6 players.

Integrates with

Cat Tower
Cat Tower Plus
160617.name: Cat Tower Lite

160618.name: New Star GP
160618.description:
New Star GP is a top-down racing game inspired by classic games such as Super Sprint and Micro Machines, but brought bang up to date with features such as realistic handling, pit-stops, replays, online multi-player and more.

Source: The Developer Website.

Online play was introduced in the v1.15 update to the game.

160619.name: Campaign of first 9 years
160619.description:
Second issue game of Wargame Japanese History #21.

This game uses the same rule and map as "Aterui saga". But it uses different counters.

This campaign is less popular even in Japan. It started in 1051 more than 200 years after Aterui saga. And it ended in 1062.
Basically, this campaign was conducted by the central government against an unloyal Abe-clan.

160620.name: Public Enemy
160620.description:
From publisher blurb:

Public Enemy, the second supplement of the Double Cross Roleplaying Game, introduces the ability to create playable villain characters. With new abilities and items, your bad guys and antiheros will be more powerful and unique compared to the standard fare.

Included with Public Enemy is the Random Scenario system, which allows players to decide major plot points and outcomes with a roll of the dice. Depending on how well created the story template is, a table may forgo having a dedicated GM. Even if a Random Scenario system itself is not used, its supplementary enemy data and abilities can easily be incorporated into a regular session.

In this new supplement, you will get:

New Trait Loises and Items.
Five new sample characters.
A more detailed look into the False Hearts organization and the motivations of its members.
The Random Scenario System. The dice determines what happens during your story and adventure.
New enemy abilities and sample bosses.
Includes two sample Scenarios.

160621.name: The Visitors
160621.description:
The Visitors are coming, hellbent on world domination.

The Visitors is a cooperative 1 to 4 player game where the players are sent to a haunted manor with the objective of stop any manifestation of their arrival. Players take turn eliminating the haunting from the rooms of the manor and dealing with whatever Visitor that might appear.

The game ends after all the Visit cards have been used, meaning that they have successfully managed to stop their invasion. It will also end if 3 Visitors are present in the board at the same time, as they have become too strong to be defeated now.

Players are allocated 3 action points on their turn, and can choose to move to an adjacent room or to use a trinket in order to destroy a manifestation. Each Visitor brought on to the board makes the game harder as more Visit cards have to be drawn, with the extra effect of speeding up gameplay.

With a modular board and rules that allow for difficulty tweaking, no two playthroughs will be the same!

160622.name: Slicks 'n' Slide
160622.description:
User Summary

Slicks 'n' Slide is a racing game from 1993 developed by Finnish programmer Timo Kauppinen. Players race around a selection of tracks using various vehicles. The game has a high number of changeable options and includes a track editor (though not in the shareware version). Each of the four vehicle slots can be toggled between human, AI and 'off' allowing for four player races (played via one keyboard or joysticks), a mixture of human and AI players, or a solely AI race. Later updates to the game introduced weaponry.

160623.description:
A solo print-n-play game of tomb-raiding and jungle exploration.

Enter the temple, grab the Golden Idol and make it back to the landing site before the angry natives and hungry jungle critters catch you!

Raiders in my Pocket is a modification of Zombie in my Pocket, with a re-implemented theme and some rules variations to reinforce the new theme. Most significant of these is the special 4th time period "Storm", which triggers when you steal the Golden Idol and anger the ancient gods of the temple, starting a doomsday clock until darkness takes over... will you make it back to the plane on time?

Rcommended background music: The Indiana Jones Theme tune, which coincidentally lasts about as long as it takes to play :)
160623.name: Raiders in my Pocket

160624.name: Sensational Soccer
160624.description:
Take control of your favourite team in this classically-styled football action game. Ping one-touch passes around, dribble your way through the defence and place a curving shot in the top corner! Compete in league and cup competitions or even play against your friends.

• Play against a friend in the 2 player mode.
• Playable with either Keyboard or Joystick or Mouse.
• Full player database featuring all the squads from over 40 leagues worldwide with realistic player stats.
• Complete challenges to unlock soccer star portraits in the gallery.

Source: The Developer Website.

160625.name: Uhrwerk! Das Magazin (Ausgabe 2 - 2014)
160625.description:
The second issue has many articles incorporating fire as recurring theme. Short stories, previews, setting descriptions, scenarios, and extra material (archetypes, weapons) for various games published/ licensed by Uhrwerk.

Additionally, there's a GMing essay (running SF although you're used to fantasy) and a convention report.

160626.name: Sensational World Soccer 2010
160626.description:
Sensational World Soccer is a classic 2D style football game featuring 32 international teams. Compete in the greatest football tournament in the world and lift the cup!

• Realistic world tournament
• 32 international teams
• Compete against a friend in the 2 player mode
• Save and load replays of your greatest goals
• Edit tactics
• Classic 1 button system for easy control!

Source: The Developer Website.

160628.description:
Dilemma is a two-player strategy game in which players compete by moving pawns around the board to collect tiles worth varying points.

The 49 tiles are placed in a preset pattern on a 7x7 grid, and two pawns are placed on top of two tiles in the central diagonal. One player can move the pawns along columns, while the other moves them along rows. Players cannot move the same pawn they moved the previous turn, so strategy is built around knowing which choices your opponent has next, and working to make those choices miserable — thus putting them in a dilemma. Some of the tiles affect the board when collected: moving tiles or pawns, returning pieces to the board, or stealing tiles from an opponent. When neither player can move, the game ends and whoever has the most points wins.

Skillful maneuvering and forethought are the name of the game in this engaging, classical board game.
160628.name: Dilemma

160629.name: New Star Soccer Trials
160629.description:
User Summary

New Star Soccer Trials is a simple football (soccer) challenge game. The aim is to set a high score playing through 10 levels of trials kicking a football to knock over cones, to bounce within a green & yellow target, or to stop dead on a red & yellow target. The fewer footballs needed to complete each challenge, the higher the score. The game is played via mouse to aim, click-and-hold to increase the power of the kick.

160630.name: Bunnies vs Zombies
160630.description:
Bunnies vs Zombies is a board game in which carrots and brains are your currency, and cuteness counts for nothing! Hordes of flesh-eating zombies have risen from their graves in search of brains, and a village of cute cuddly bunnies is on the menu. With the annual carrot harvest fast approaching, an assault from the undead could not have come at a worse possible time! Without the carrot harvest, the cute wittle bunnies will all starve. There is only one thing left to do! FIGHT BACK!.

Bunnies vs Zombies is a standalone board game that includes everything you need to survive the ensuing zombie apocalypse! Featuring over 35 detailed game pieces, 7 game modes, a fully illustrated game board, game cards, tokens, barriers, and rulebook.

160631.name: Tschu-Tschu-Tschu... Die Eisenbahn
160631.description:
Tschu-tschu-tschu...the railroad is a game with a colour die. It contains 5 wooden tiles depicting locomotives, 15 tiles depicting railroad passenger wagons and 4 smaller tiles depicting conductors. And then there is the 6-sided colour die.

From the publishers description on the back side of the game box: Tschu-tschu-tschu... the railroad is a colour die game made from wood. When the locomotive is steaming and ready the train be quite quick. Two or more build a common train or build their own one. Made from wood, so childrens hands can have a strong grip too. The game: From the wooden tiles coloured trains are built. The die sets the colour so everyone has a chance in this fast-paced tile laying game made out of wood.

The rulebook suggests two games: In one game one locomotive is put in the middle of the table. The wagons are shuffled and dealt to the players. The players take turns rolling the die and then adding to the locomotive if they have rolled the appropriate colour or black which is a joker in this game. The first player getting rid of all his/her wagon tiles is the rounds winner and gets a conductor tile. After 4 rounds the game ends, the player with the most conductors wins.

In a second variant each player gets a locomotive and the wagon tiles are put in the middle of the table. Then there must be an agreement which train will be the winning one: The longest one, the most colourful on or one in a single colour. Players take turns rolling the die and taking a wagon of the rolled colour. The rulebook is unclear if taking a wagon is optional or compulsory in this variant.

160632.description:
The players move on the game board through several levels, where they have to answer questions from different themed game cards or follow the instructions on the Event Cards. If a Player answers a question correctly, he continnues till he doesn't know the correct answer to a question or an Event Card ends his move. Movement is determined by a die. The first player to reach the center of the game board, wins the game.

This game was produced as a promotional giveaway for the Vivento Customer Services GmbH, a subsidiary company of Deutsche Telekom AG.
160632.name: VCS: Das Königsspiel

160634.name: Sports Flip!
160634.description:
User Summary

Sports Flip! is a falling piece puzzle game in which players must group tiles of the same type of sports ball together, then clear them from the screen by landing the appropriate piece of sports equipment ('bats') on top of them.

The balls and bats used in the game are: tennis balls and rackets (yellow pieces), cricket balls and bats (red), soccer balls and boots (green) and baseballs and bats (blue).

Each piece that falls is composed of two tiles which may be bats or balls, and these can rotated through 90 degree increments with Z and X keys. Pieces are moved left, right and dropped with the arrow keys, and the up key flips the piece, changing balls into bats and vice versa, hence the name of the game. You only have a limited number of flips available, displayed at the bottom of the screen. Points are awarded for the number of tiles cleared, and combos of clearances score highly. Play continues until the pieces stack to the top of the screen.

160636.name: Ruins of Tarlac Keep
160636.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fresh off the adventure trail your party takes refuge at the small caravan stop at the Village of Tomore. There your party hears a bard tell the tale of “Tarlac Keep” which was laid siege to by two dragons and a horde of humanoids. While the mighty keep fell the subsequent military action was enough to quell further issues. By the end of the tale your group feels that a real estate deal may be in the making for you….

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for a mid-level adventure party and DM. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

160637.name: Drip by Bloody Drip
160637.description:
From publisher blurb:

The group is hired to grab some medical research files from an abandoned naval base on the Puget Sound. Seems simple enough, except nobody thought to deactivate the base’s security systems. Can the group survive military-grade security robots and drones long enough to retrieve the data? And why is another recovery team on the base?

Drip by Bloody Drip is an adventure for 3 to 5 characters of Seasoned rank or higher.

160638.name: Extraction with Extreme Prejudice (Savage Worlds)
160638.description:
From publisher blurb:

The job seems simple enough; grab a high profile geneticist from Bio Solutions, and deliver him to the contractor. In, out, done. Easy Peasy, right? Wrong. Word spreads fast in the sprawl, and once the wolves hear about the dandy diaper baby coming down from his ivory tower, he becomes a huge payday, and everyone wants to cash in. Will the characters complete the job as promised? Or will they succumb to greed and sell the mark to the highest bidder?

Do they even have a choice?

Extraction with Extreme Prejudice is an adventure for 3 to 5 characters. This adventure also includes Fast, Furious and Fun rules for creating your own safe house!

160639.name: From Gaza with Love
160639.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the Middle East!

The trophy wife of a brutish Russian-Israeli oligarch falls for a charming Arab taxi driver and the two elope to Gaza. Some time later, her kids are gone, snatched off the street by Bedouin thugs-for-hire. Dame wants her kids back and has the credits to make your time worthwhile. Classic story.

First question to pop into your head -- are you willing to brave the radioactive Negev desert and the bio-horrors it spawned, the Israeli border patrol with its drones and bots, and the Russian Mafia with its Russian Mafia? Sure you are, that's all in the freaking job description.

But then, there's a second question ringing in your brain -- on whose toes you gonna step if you take this job? Why are Israeli drones always buzzing above? What game is the Russian FSB playing? And who invited the Kurds for the party?

From gaza with Love is an adventure for 3 to 5 players.

160640.name: Pits & Perils
160640.description:
From publisher blurb:

Pits & Perils is an "original" old-school role-playing game. One modeled after the numerous war games-turned-fantasy RPG campaigns that proliferated during the early 1970s. Back then, it was crappy little rule books typed in someone's basement. Well, those days are back!

Pits & Perils has:

Classic character types, but with a twist (check out a FULL preview of the character rules on this page).
Extremely simple mechanics (perhaps the simplest ever) that can be tailored to nearly any situation. Most of what the players do is decision-making, exploration, and role-playing. The rules don't even try to do this for you. And you know what? They shouldn't!
Nearly 100 monsters to fight and 200 magic items to win and wield. All of them fully explained. That's a lot for an 80-page rule book!




An amateur look and feel that captures the way things used to be. In those days, each group had its own homemade rules based on word of mouth and the historical war games they were already playing. Pits & Perils is designed in this spirit.

Pits & Perils is NOT a retro-clone, but an original system designed for those who want an old-school experience without excessive rules. This book contains everything needed to get started, including how to create a character, build a dungeon, and run a campaign in a world where magic still works and monsters are real. So live and die by the sword. Or magic, if you prefer. Dark dungeons await...

160641.name: Pits & Perils Referee Companion
160641.description:
From publisher blurb:

Quick reference charts for the Pits & Perils game, including new rules and guidance!

160642.name: Fear! Fire! Foes!
160642.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fear! Fire! Foes! is a supplement to Pits & Perils. It adds a wealth of original content to the game while preserving its old-school look and feel, not to mention simplicity...

Pits & Perils II, Fear! Fire! Foes! has:

Variant character classes, like the eastern monk and psychic savant. Or become an elven fighter and combine magic with deadly combat maneuvers.
New equipment, including healing herbs and holy oils.
Advancement to level 15, giving players time to experience higher level adventures!
Powerful new spells. Master shape shifting and create vivid illusions - or wield fire and ice bolts against an array of terrifying new enemies.
Combat moves, like stunning blocks and parries, that make combat dynamic while preserving the simplicity of the basic game. Fighting has never been deadlier...
Awesome new enemies, including extra-dimensional invaders and even the gods themselves. Journey to prehistoric worlds or fight the fiery minions of Hell. It's all in the book!




Fear! Fire! Foes! preserves the old-school look and feel of the basic rules while greatly expanding its fantastic horizons. Those already playing will find a wealth of new material to enhance their campaigns. And for anyone thinking about it - this is a great time to start! Old-school never felt so new...

160643.description:
Asterisk is an abstract connection game in which players aim to create several connections at once. It is a descendant of the Game of Y.

Each player has three goals: to connect the three sides of the board with pieces of his or her own color (dark or light), shape (hexagonal or circular), and marking (asterisked or empty). But none of the pieces will serve all three of a player's goals, so every piece played potentially benefits the opponent. There are a limited number of pieces of each type.

The winner is the player to make two or more of his or her connections.
160643.name: Asterisk

160644.description:
The Rock'em Sock'em Robots Dice Game tries to emulate the fast action of the Rock'em Sock'em Robots of old, with players rolling their dice as quickly as they can to get the same face on all dice — colors or icons, depending on a flip of the match coin. Whoever does this first flips one of the opponent's face-down life markers face up. Two of these markers are blank, and the other three have hits; if all three of your hits are revealed, you lose.

If you've been hit, you can try to roll "block" on all your dice. If you do, flip one of your face-up markers face down again, then shuffle it with your remaining face-down markers.
160644.name: Rock'em Sock'em Robots Dice Game

160645.name: Feats of Dirty Fighting
160645.description:
From publisher blurb:

The 21st in our series of Mythic Minis, Feats of Dirty Fighting brings you 7 mythic feats for your mythic dastards who love pulling dirty tricks in combat, from toxic feats like Adder Strike and Pinpoint Poisoner to treacherous tactics like Punishing Kick and Vicious Stomp.

160646.name: Villain Gazette Volume 1, Issue 11
160646.description:
From publisher blurb:


For Great Victory, Great Villains!

Sometimes, you just need stuff to beat up. Here, in the Villain Gazette, we provide a villain, their minions, and some cool new stuff for both sides to use. In this issue:

Black Razor, Near-Modern Mistress of Sharpness!
Black Razor's Cheerleaders, the Chrome Squad!
A selection of Exotic High-Tech Weaponry!




See the Villain's stats, learn their secrets, and prepare to depooy them on PCs in need of conflict. Includes the Redeemability Scale rating of the villlain (so you know if they can be salvaged), and Adventure Seeds for bringing the villain into YOUR campaign!

160647.name: Mythic Spells of the Nile
160647.description:
From publisher blurb:

Master the Magic of the Nile!

The magic of the Old Kingdom is potent, but it is also hidden, and in many places has been all but forgotten. This book contains 5 new Egyptian-themed spells for players of a variety of classes, as well as mythic versions of those spells.

The dreaded and powerful sandstorm can create searing winds that will slowly sear everything in mile radius (or more, with mythic power), and also unleashes a devastating cyclone of sandy destruction in the heart of that storm. If you prefer a more subtle approach, use beetle bore to animate a tiny scarab which burrows into the heart of your victim, weakening and quite possibly killing him. Blood scrying draws on the proud Egyptian tradition of blood magic and allows you to look into the past, or even the future, while insatiable thirst leaves victims gasping for water as they frantically scramble to avoid dying of dehydration. Finally, tomb hex is the ultimate spell for guarding any door or portal, and with mythic power it not only stops intruders, but may also turn them into undead guardians who continue to protect the warded place even after the spell ends.

160648.name: Collectanea Creaturae (Monsters & Magic)
160648.description:
From publisher blurb:

How Does One Measure a Hero?

By His Enemies.

Within these pages, you will find over 150 creatures for your Monsters & Magic heroes to face, ranging from the mundane - bears, wolves, and sharks - to the truly monstrous - demons, titans, and dragons.

But these are not simply stacks of hit points for you to whittle down. The creatures within are presented with motivations, social actions, and personality. Your players can try to strike a deal with a goblin trader, negotiate with a centaur tribe, frolic with fauns, or look for a way to lay an unfortunate shade to rest.

Further, twenty-four creatures are presented for use as familiars and animals companions for your PCs, and seven new PC races added to those already available in the core Monsters & Magic rules.

160649.name: Collectanea Creaturae (Fate)
160649.description:
From publisher blurb:

How Does One Measure a Hero?

By His Enemies.

Within these pages, you will find over 160 creatures for your Fate Core heroes to face, ranging from the mundane - bears, wolves, and sharks - to the truly monstrous - demons, titans, and dragons.

In true Fate Core fashion, these creatures are presented with an eye toward dramatic use, with aspects, skills, stunts, and extras that guide their use not only in combat, but also as characters to interact with. Your characters can strike a deal with a goblin trader, negotiate with a centaur tribe, frolic with fauns, or look for a way to lay an unfortunate shade to rest.

In addition, an appendix is presented with suggestions on using many of the creatures within as NPC companions for your PCs.

160650.name: Who is the Sunflower?
160650.description:
It is said that angels poured courage into a seed, then planted it into the soil of the human world, and that is how sunflowers came to be.

And so it happens that on a beautiful island a student-led social movement breaks out. If only they can find the legendary sunflower that hides great power within him, the movement can prevail, and so the student leader will use any means necessary to find it; but the government is dispatching police to hinder him, spread disinformation and sow confusion. What kind of future will the island have?

Who is the Sunflower is a microgame in which two secret teams face off, trying to discover each other's identity. Each player gets an identity card. Some characters need to identify certain other character (e.g. Student wants to find Sunflower), while others need to be identified by certain character (Banana wants to be found by the Student). After some discussion, players that need to find another character can attempt to guess who that character is. If this fulfills any player's victory condition, the round ends, with those players scoring a point each.

160651.name: Arcana Rising
160651.description:
From publisher blurb:

Arcana Rising is a modern-day urban fantasy role-playing game that posits a world where magic and the supernatural have awakened once more after millennia of slumber beneath the frozen ice of the Antarctic.

Generations ago, the source of all raw magic was sealed away beneath the frozen ice of the southernmost continent, but now, with the breaching of the ancient seal by Russian scientists, magic once again flows throughout the world as it once did. Wizardry is once more a genuine calling, the divine influence is making itself known in greater strength than has been seen on the Earth in human memory, and with the return of magic, supernatural creatures that had long fled to the outer planes where magic still held sway are once again encroaching into the material realm and threatening mankind.

Players will take on classic fantasy roles thrust into our world, modern day wizards, adventurers, and holy champions, who seek out the knowledge of the lost era of magic and attempt to protect mankind from the supernatural beings that now threaten it, while juggling their mundane lives around the demands of a life of danger confronting unholy threats from beyond the veil.

Arcana Rising is powered by the same core system as the critically-acclaimed Hulks and Horrors science-fiction role-playing game. The H&H Engine brings a simple to learn set of rules inspired by the classic fantasy role-playing games of Gygax, Mentzer, and Ward.

7 core classes with rules up to level 12 and beyond, each a new spin on the classics: Gunfighter, Gladiator, Rogue, Wizard, Cleric, Champion, and Forestwalker
A Day Job system, representing the characters' day to day careers
A new skill system that aims to provide the skilled with better talent and success without blocking off options
Arcane magic and Divine prayer, with spell lists for each up to level 6
Rules for generating magical treasures and artifacts from the ancient era
Over 100 classic fantasy and folkloric monsters
GM advice and tools for modern and urban fantasy adventuring
Alternate 'genre packages' and rules for other game concepts from traditional medieval fantasy to post-apocalyptic horror

160652.name: Dysphiron
160652.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dysphiron Awaits!

Enter a land of fantasy and magic that has somehow gone awry. The Orcbrand Empire has stood for over a thousand years, a testament to tyranny, savagery, and pointy hats.

Times are about to change, however, as your group of slaves turned adventurers seeks out a way to join the resistance against the empire, fighting to free the other races from the clutches of the orcs.

Written for Mini Six, Dysphiron, Volume One: The Escape is a multi-part adventure module that start a new group out on their quest to fight the Orcbrand Empire and once more bring freedom to Dysphiron.

160653.name: Journey to the Forge
160653.description:
From publisher blurb:

As we all make our first actual journey to FORGE's first year, Protagonist Games though it would be fitting for our games to travel there as well.

An epic journey to find an ancient and powerful dwarven forge, Journey to the Forge takes players through a con gaming experience full of intrigue, danger, and the choice to use ultimate power for good or for evil. This module is playable with just a copy of Mini Six, some paper, a handful of dice, and a pencil.

Pre-generated characters are included, which means the adventure can be run with a minimum of previous preparation.

Journey onward, and may your adventures be heroic!

160654.name: Dolly's Bookworm
160654.description:
Dolly's Bookworm is the book lover's game of hide and seek! Like 20 Questions for books, the objective of the game is to find the Bookworm hidden by the Librarian somewhere in a bookshelf of over 30 books. Players ask Yes or No questions to remove books from the shelves, narrowing the choices until the Bookworm is found. With simple rules, three shelves, four Bookworms, over 65 titles to pick from, and player questions limited only by your imagination, no two games will ever be the same!

Pre-readers can ask questions about the younger titles' colors, locations, and pictures. They can also use the icons to know if there is magic in the game and if the main characters are male, female, or animals.

Older players can test themselves by asking detailed plot and character questions about the older titles. They can also hide multiple bookworms, add a timer, and/or leave the books on the shelf for a serious mental challenge!

160655.name: Investars
160655.description:
Investars is a collaborative game, where players work together to collectively achieve Big Goals, accumulate money in their retirement savings account, use their individual salaries to Invest in companies, and try to get all their pieces back Home to retire and win.

Investars is played in rounds, each simulating a decade in your life. The team starts in their 20s with a salary, multiple Stock Tokens to invest in companies, and empty savings accounts. Every round starts with paying salaries, doubling the value of each savings account, and rolling the dice to find which companies pay off investments - or potentially go out of business. If companies go out of business, their tiles are removed from the game, potentially blocking players' paths to the Big Goals and Home. Then, it is the team’s turn, and each player makes several actions toward winning the game: Move, Invest, Achieve, Save, or Withdraw.

With good planning, lots of teamwork, and a bit of luck, players will achieve their Big Goals and retire in style as successful Investars!

As a bonus, while you're having fun playing Investars, you'll also learn a bit about compound interest, savings accounts, and planning for long-term goals. In short, you'll learn how to be better investors!

160656.name: Salt Merchant
160656.description:
Your grandfather started a salt manufacturing business fifty years ago. After thriving for many years, the salt business is now in trouble. Faced by tough competition and a lack of good management, there's a risk of business going bankrupt. It's up to you to take up this challenge and save this family business.

Salt Merchant is a card game of business, luck, math and strategy. Each player becomes a salt merchant and tries to outplay other players and become the first to set up the maximum number of salt manufacturing factories and hence earn maximum money. Your challenges are to acquire good labor and factories, dig more salt water wells, and automate your factories. There's tough competition, too, so you have to be smart, make the right moves, and set-up factories of all different types if you want to regain lost glory.

160658.description:
Postcard Cthulhu is a cooperative Worker Placement game, where the players are Researchers attempting to postpone Cthulhu from rising from his watery grave.

The game is played on a postcard using coins. Each player takes a turn flipping some of the coins in their hand of coins to determine where they are able to play. They then place one coin on the map and this activates the special ability of that particular location. It might allow the players to draw more coins or move coins on the map along arrows, for example.

Each turn the current player flips 3 coins for Cthulhu which causes Cthulhu to steal coins from the players or fill up the Carcosa track, limiting the maximum hand size of all players.

The players win if they can get 3 heads on two particular locations on the board and Cthulhu wins if it steals enough coins from the players or fills up the Carcosa track. The type of coins used is not important.
160658.name: Postcard Cthulhu

160659.name: Thieves!
160659.description:
This card game simulates a dungeon crawl if the entire party was made up of thieves.

Each player is a thief and plays a Chamber card which gives some information about the next room the party is about to enter. This card is played face down and the current player describes its contents, generally by lying. Each player then plays a card face down to express how they intend to deal with the upcoming room, and then everything is revealed.

The players accumulate treasures which equate to victory points and also give each player some special powers depending on the treasure captured.

160660.name: Cavewars
160660.description:
From the Game Manual / Box

CAVEWARS puts you into a subterranean fantasy world of vicious combat and empire building. Each player starts with one city deep below the surface of a hostile planet. Beginning with primitive weapons, a small knowledge of magic and a diminishing supply of metal; you must explore, expand, mine metal and conquer to survive. Build better weapons, learn to forge stronger metals, improve your knowledge of magic and there will be no end to what you can build, summon or unleash upon your enemies. Lag behind in the race for resources and technology and you will be crushed.


A 3-dimensional world -- 5 levels of caverns and tunnels.



Customize your armies, select their weapons, armour and mounts. Build catapults, cannons -- even mobile artillery and rocket launchers when your technology allows it!



Random map generator allows you to build infinite subterranean worlds!



Play up to four other computer or human players.

160661.description:
A set of three double-sided promo cards for Galactic Strike Force: one side depicting the Swangee Automaton Tech card, the other side showing the Broodax Repositor Ship card.

The Swangee Automaton allows you to swap the attack and defense values of an opposing ship; and the Broodax ship will automatically move to the sector with the fewest player ships.

These cards were a Kickstarter bonus.
160661.name: Galactic Strike Force: Promo Cards

160662.name: Chrome
160662.description:
User Description:

A Near Future Cyberpunk Dystopian playset for Fiasco.

This playset was created by NimbyDagda and other members of the UKRoleplayers.com community.

160663.name: Run 3
160663.description:
User Summary

An endless runner-type game, Run 3 sees you playing as 'the runner', trying to find your way home through space tunnels. The runner is in constant forward motion and you must dodge left and right with the arrow keys to avoid falling off the path. You can also jump holes in the floor with spacebar. Moving to the sides of the path rotates the whole tunnel 90 degrees so the wall becomes the floor. The levels get more difficult as you go through the game and different characters are unlocked as you progress.

In addition to the Explore mode, there is an Infinite mode where the aim is simply to run for as long as possible.

The game is the third in the Run series. It was initially released for mobile devices titled just 'Run' due to it being the series' debut on Android. When later released for web browsers its full title 'Run 3' was used.

172655.name: Warmachine: High Command – Faith & Fortune: Engines of Destruction

160664.description:
As the fires of war engulf western Immoren, the call for great leaders has never been stronger. The Retribution of Scyrah and the Convergence of Cyriss muster their forces to wage war on a new scale. Mercenary armies of the Highborn Covenant and Four Star Syndicate sell their services to the highest bidder, while also pursuing their own larger agendas. Take command of these four new factions in their battle for dominion over the Iron Kingdoms! Will you lead your faction to victory, or be crushed by the military might of your rivals?

The Warmachine: High Command – Faith & Fortune core set introduces four new factions: Retribution of Scyrah, Convergence of Cyriss, Highborn Covenant, and Four Star Syndicate. This core set is a standalone deck-building card game with everything 2–4 players need to play and can be customized with expansion releases for the included factions. Leverage your resources, rally your armies, and dominate your foes to set your banner above all of western Immoren!

Warmachine: High Command – Faith & Fortune can be combined with the following other core sets:

Warmachine: High Command
Hordes: High Command
160664.name: Warmachine: High Command – Faith & Fortune

160666.name: The Holy Grail
160666.description:
From the game box

For centuries, Valiant knights have persued in vain the fabled Holy Grail. And now a man of tyranny, Your stepbrother Balnard, is closing in on it and would use its power to dominate the land. The people of the world look to you, brave adventurer, to save them from this dreaded fate.

160667.description:
Light and Shadow is a small-box expansion to BattleCON (about 120 cards or so) that includes higher-powered versions of all Fighters and the cards necessary to play them. These can be used for 2v1 or 3v1 games, or you can use this expansion to duel two of these super-fighters against each other one-on-one.

The box will contain powered-up Unique Ability cards for each fighter in BattleCON: War of Indines and BattleCON: Devastation of Indines, as well as four new sets of bases: 2 sets of "EX" bases (used with EX ability cards, making a fighter roughly twice as strong as a normal character) and 2 sets of "Almighty" bases (used with Almighty ability cards, making a fighter roughly three times as strong as normal).
160667.name: BattleCON: Light & Shadow

160668.name: World Cup Manager 2002
160668.description:
User Summary

World Cup Manager 2002 is a football (soccer) management game where you take on the role of a coach in the 2002 World Cup. The matches are presented as a running commentary on the action. You are able to determine training options between matches, and press conferences are held in which you select what response to give to questions.

There is an editor built into the game allowing you to fully edit all player and team data. The game also includes additional national squads allowing a different selection of teams to take part in the world cup.

boardgamehonor.26775: 2014 Golden Geek Best Abstract Board Game Nominee

160669.description:
In Town Center, players build a city – in particular, the town center. They add cubes on their personal board and try to arrange them as best as possible in order to score the most victory points. Each cube represents a different type of module. Flats, shops, offices, generators, lifts, car parks, town hall can be built and stacked during the course of the game. Each module generates influence on adjacent land and on cubes directly below or above.

Each round, players will gain two cubes of different colors through a non-random mechanism, build them on their game board, then eventually stack them in order to make towers according to the building rules. If the players have done their job well, some modules will be able to evolve, becoming bigger in three dimensions. The last phase is an income phase in which players gain money from the shops and parking lots if they are supplied with electricity.

The bigger and higher your city is, the more victory points players will have at the end of the game, which lasts ten rounds – but do not forget to provide electricity to all your flats, shops, and lifts to make them more efficient.


Changes in the fourth edition:

Has a new map printed on the reverse of the boards. Earlier editions of Town Center did not have 2 maps, just 1. This means that each of the player boards has an alternate city plan to play with.

Contains the Central Park solo board, previously released separately as the Manhattan t-shirt, on the back of the central board.

Has a bigger box that now fits all the cubes comfortably, and has space for expansions.

Has a bigger rulebook, in separate languages, with updated rules, including rules for up to 8 players to play together by combining two sets of the game.

16 player cubes in 8 colors in each box to allow for games with more than 4 players, by combining 2 copies of Town Center.

Revamped player maps with wider streets that are compatible with future planned expansions.

Added central board with a track around it, a simpler method to track income and points.

Improved player aid that now includes Phase V (in Editions 1–3, Phases IV and V were both encompassed in Phase IV) and more detail in Phase I explanation.

Doubled the size of the cloth bag - now all cubes can all be stored in it without spilling out, and there's space for enough cubes for 5-8 players to be pulled from it.

Note: You need two copies of the same edition* (or a copy of the 3rd edition and a copy of the 4th edition) to play with up to 8 players. Each copy contains enough building cubes and player boards for up to 4 players.

* 3rd and 4th edition are the only 2 editions with the same size of cubes. 1st edition's much smaller cubes, 2nd editions LEGO bricks, and Deluxe edition's way larger cubes are not compatible with the 3rd and 4th edition cubes; the 5–8-player rules require all players to select their cubes from the same draft towers.
160669.name: Town Center (4th edition)

160670.name: Euro Cup Manager 2004
160670.description:
User Summary

Euro Cup Manager 2004 is a football (soccer) management game. You are in the role of a national coach taking part in the 2004 European Championships. The matches themselves are presented via a running text commentary. You are able to select your team and tactics, and choose training options and attend press conferences between matches.

The game has an editor function which allows amendments to any of the player data and team data, and even permits alternate national squads to be chosen to take part in the tournament.

160671.description:
In Infected, you and your friends play human characters as they encounter a pack of wounded infected. You manage to kill them off but a few of your buddies got bit and are starting to turn.

At the start of each turn, you roll dice corresponding to your weapon or mutation. The dice show the following three symbols: Card, Heal, and Attack.

There are five card types that will add additional gear, weapons and benefits.

In order to win the game, your group must eliminate the opposing side.

Inspiration: Bang!, Shadow Hunter, King of Tokyo
160671.name: Infected

160673.description:
This version of Dominion: Intrigue is an expansion that requires the Dominion base game or Dominion: Base Cards to play.

In Dominion: Intrigue (as with Dominion), each player starts with an identical, very small deck of cards. In the center of the table is a selection of other cards the players can "buy" as they can afford them. Through their selection of cards to buy, and how they play their hands as they draw them, the players construct their deck on the fly, striving for the most efficient path to the precious victory points by game end.

Part of the Dominion series.
160673.name: Dominion: Die Intrige – Erweiterung

160674.description:
Ausnahmezustand is the German edition of Nightfall: Martial Law. It is an expansion for Nightfall. It is not playable without the base game. It contains 207 cards opposed to the 312 cards of Martial Law. Martial Law is a standalone game, playable on its own.

Nightfall is a deck-building game featuring direct head-to-head combat.

Before the game begins, there is a draft to determine which cards are available for purchase, and by whom. During this draft players select two cards from the set for their personal archives, and they also select cards to put into the common area. The cards drafted into personal archives may only be purchased by the player who drafted them. After the table has been set with the private and common cards, players begin play.

The meat of Nightfall is in the chaining mechanic. Each card has a main color and two linking colors. If you can match the main color of a card to one of the linking colors of the previous card, you can chain those cards together. Once a chain is started, players all get an opportunity to link additional cards onto the chain during that turn.

Cards in the chain resolve in reverse order: first in, last out. Instant effects fire off as cards come off the chain, doing damage to your opponents or bringing characters into play to defend you and attack your opponents.

The object of Nightfall is to put wounds into your opponents’ decks and end the game with the least amount of wounds in your deck. But beware: the more wounds a person has, the more enraged they become and the faster their deck works.
160674.name: Nightfall: Ausnahmezustand

160675.name: Dragons
160675.description:
From publisher blurb:

The 13th volume in our Mythic Monsters series, Mythic Monsters: Dragons brings you a dozen and one devastatingly deadly drakes, dragons, and dragonkin. From miserly hoard-keepers to titanic warlords and engines of destruction, dragons epitomize all that a mythic monster would ever want to be. Here you will find chromatic dragons of terrifying size and surpassing lethality, from the juvenile blue and adult green to the ancient black, great wyrm white, and great wyrm red! The dragons' lesser kin, the drakes, are also featured, including the flame drake, forest drake, frost drake, and sea drake! Being just a little less deadly than a true dragon is hardly an indictment on their fearsome ferocity, of course, and each brings a set of unique and special talents to the battlefield, including the brand-new mythic monster, the carrion-craving fell drake, ally and steed to undead warlords that rule benighted badlands and ruined kingdoms of death. The product is rounded out by some special members of the extended dragon family, including ranging from the colossal pyroclastic terror that is the tor linnorm to the tiny but studious pseudodragon, friend to mages and loremasters everywhere, and the half-breed dracolisk, spawned from the unholy union of a depraved dragon and a bestial basilisk. As if these mythic dragons were not enough, Mythic Monsters: Dragons also equips your mythic dragons with an array of mythic feats with which to supercharge their already formidable abilities to bite, breathe, crush, and devour all who dare to stand against them. The 13 dragons contained herein, ranging in CR from 2 to 27, are updated for the mythic rules, and when we say updated we mean complete stat blocks, yes, but more than that every one of these terrible lizards has its own unique and exciting new mythic abilities, from a mythic green dragon's bilious spew and chlorinous miasma to the onrushing avalanche and glacial palisade of a mythic white dragon!

160676.name: New Star Hockey
160676.description:
New Star Hockey is the computer game where you are the next up and coming hockey star!

Train, play in one of six leagues, and work your way towards the Hockey Hall of Fame. But there's always the pesky coach, the fickle fans, and unhappy teammates which could derail your way towards stardom! Whatever your path, it's your career!

Source: The Developer Website.

User Summary

New Star Hockey is an ice hockey game programmed by New Star Games forumer Statto and modelled after New Star Soccer. You play as a professional ice hockey player balancing the various demands made on you throughout your career. Matches are presented as a running text commentary. The game allows full customisation of the teams and leagues.

160678.name: Three Days Until Retirement
160678.description:
From the Publisher's Website:

Three Days Until Retirement is a fast-paced, over-the-top, well-hyphenated game about loose-cannon police officers trying to solve one last case before they retire. The game uses playing cards instead of dice and is designed for those new to gaming as well as grumpy veteran gamers who are looking for something new.

Across the space of a few hours, two to four players assume the role of grizzled police officers and one player assumes the role of Game Runner. The players must interrogate, investigate and intimidate their way through a nefarious plot and deal justice to the criminal scum that plague the streets of Metro City.

160679.name: Gold Timex #1: Suburban Gothic
160679.description:
From the Introduction:

Gold Timex is an expansion for Three Days Until Retirement which provides supplemental rules, a new and different setting, and an exciting playable adventure. Each gold timex has a separate theme designed to explore different methods of game play and storytelling. This is the inaugural issue of Gold Timex and the theme is Suburban Gothic.

160680.name: Twizmo! Original
160680.description:
Twizmo! is made up of two parts. A Twizmo cube, which is a twistable puzzle cube with 9 faces per side, and a deck of square cards. In Twizmo Original, the faces and cards are made up of 6 symbols. The 54 cards have 9 of each symbol, as does the Twizmo cube.

Twizmo! Original’s simple rules bely the use of spatial and deductive reason along with strategy and a little bit of luck needed for a win. Its thoughtful pace is great for bringing young and old minds together and its universal appeal transcends language and culture.

Twizmo! is all about creating sets of three matching icons. Players take turns twisting the cube, with the goal of creating “three-in-a row” groups of similar icons on the top panel. A “3-in-a-row” set on the cube allows a player to collect all of the visible cards with the matching icon.

When players have collected 3 cards with the same icon, they may turn that set face down; that card set is “closed” and cannot be taken by another player.

To win the game, collect the most card sets, or at any time during the game, collect a set of all nine matching cards for an instant win!

160681.name: Three Days Until Retirement Player's Guide
160681.description:
From the Introduction:

On Monday morning, the police chief calls you into his office. You figure you're probably going to get your chops busted for something again. When you enter, you see the police chief, some other grizzled veteran officers and some pencil-neck accountant-looking guy.

The police chief puffs on his cigar and nods at the pencil-neck who coughs at the smoke and says, "We have a situation. There appears to be a rash of crime throughout Metro City that might be related in some way. It looks bad for the mayor, and it's an election year. We need this taken care of now, and we need this taken care of quietly." It's almost cute how the nerdling's voice cracks when he tries to sound tough.

160682.name: Big Bucks Football
160682.description:
It's all about the big bucks with Big Buck's Football!

It’s time for your favorite team to play—all your friends are over and ready to watch—everyone has their predictions—it’s time to put your money where your mouth is—see who knows the game of football best. To win, correctly predict which play is going to be next. Each play is another chance to show your football knowledge and win BIG BUCKS!

Any American Football game will do. Game play is based on the actions of the teams and the results of each play and/or drive.

The player with the most Big Bucks at the end of the game, wins.

160683.description:
Game description from the publisher:

What will come of one Runner's hunt for the net's legendary source protocols? The answer to this question is embedded within the core of All That Remains, the fifth Data Pack in the "Lunar Cycle" for Android: Netrunner. Its sixty new cards (three copies of each new card) include a new Criminal Runner identity, a new shard of the source protocols, and a host of assets designed to support the ambitions and secrecy of those Corporations that have the most investment in lunar development.

Additionally, a number of other cards ensure that every action ripples outward and spurs new responses. You’ll find a trio of Corp agendas with powerful "when scored" abilities and trace cards that can hit the Runner even if their traces fail.

Data never dies. It just takes deadly new twists. Explore the ends to which they lead in All That Remains.
160683.name: Android: Netrunner – All That Remains

160684.description:
Game description from the publisher:

"Lysa knew more than she had dared to put in her letter. She might have the very proof that Ned needed to bring the Lannisters to ruin, and if it came to war, they would need the Arryns and the eastern lords who owed them service." –George R.R. Martin, A Game of Thrones

Secrets and Schemes is the first Chapter Pack in the "Wardens" cycle for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game.

Lords and ladies across the Seven Kingdoms have fought for the Iron Throne. Many have died. Still others have held back, aloof and apart. In Secrets and Schemes, you will discover sixty new cards (three copies each of twenty different cards) that touch upon the schemes these patient individuals have concocted. Additionally, you’ll learn how they make their opening moves with a host of new Knights, attachments, and the agenda, Aloof and Apart, which encourages players to revisit some of the game’s most expensive, powerful, and recognizable characters.

As the first chapter of the Wardens cycle, Secrets and Schemes also begins its exploration of the House Arryn trait and the introduction of the Castle plot type, which offers powerful rewards, but only when your plot enters the used plot pile. Additionally, a number of card introduce powerful new “Limited Response” abilities, which add new dimensions to this game term by moving it to the center of more meaningful decisions.
160684.name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – Secrets and Schemes

39953.name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game

160685.name: Goosebumps: Escape from HorrorLand
160685.description:
Escape from HorrorLand was released in 1996 on the PC. The game acts as a sequel to the Goosebumps book One Day at Horrorland. Lizzie, one of the protagonists from the book, calls the player character to her that night, stating that her brother Luke and friend Clay have suddenly disappeared after a strange bout of supernatural activity in her household. The only clues she has are the Horrorland tickets they got from their last encounter with the theme park.

Source: Wikipedia, "Goosebumps (video game series)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

From the gamebox:
• Easy-to-use inventory pouch.
• Fantastic photo-realistic environments.
• 9-level arcade style game.
• Challenging puzzles.
• Stunning array of monsters, villains and creepy places.
• Star performances by Jeff Goldblum and Isabella Rosellini.

160686.name: Kippelparty
160686.description:
A shaky game dexterity game for 2-4 players from 5 years old.

The turtle is taking a nap on a rock, but five little rascals are having a party on the turtles back. The game contains two very similar variants:
- All five figures start on the turtle and the spinner determines which animal has to be moved. If the turtle tips over you lose a token. Once you lost both tokens you are out of the game.
- All figures start on the table. the spinner determines which animal must be move on/off the turtle but only blue fields may be used. f the turtle tips over you lose a token. Once you lost both tokens you are out of the game.

160687.name: Goosebumps: Attack of the Mutant
160687.description:
Attack of the Mutant is a children's PC game based on the Goosebumps book Attack of the Mutant by R.L.Stine. It was developed and produced by Dreamworks Interactive and was released May 1, 1997. It was one of the first games to use cel-shaded animation.

The hero gets off a bus at the wrong stop, and finds himself at the headquarters of the Masked Mutant. Within, he must work with comic book superheroes the League of Good Guys to prevent the Masked Mutant and his evil henchmen from transforming the world into a giant comic book.

The cast of characters included all of the comic book superheroes and super villains featured in the original book - the Galloping Gazelle, the Masked Mutant and the Magnificent Molecule Man - but also added many original characters, such as the mobster villain Pinky Flamingo. The hero, a non-gender specific (though in-game art suggests a male) child, is a classic video game silent protagonist. The Galloping Gazelle was voiced by Adam West (who played the same role in the TV episode of Attack of the Mutant) while the Masked Mutant was voiced by James Belushi.

Source: Wikipedia, "Goosebumps (video game series)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

160688.name: Necropolis: Fingers Worked to the Bone
160688.description:
User Summary:

A seed for Kingdom, set in the world of Ryan Deugan's book "Engine of Change".

160689.name: Uppsala
160689.description:
From spanish editor's webpage

Suplemento para el juego de rol Yggdrasill. En este libro se detalla la legendaria y mitológica ciudad de Uppsala, capital del reino de Suecia y hogar de los temidos Reyes Hechiceros, descendientes del dios Freyr. Entre sus páginas encontrarás gran cantidad de información al respecto de la propia ciudad, sus habitantes, sus costumbres, pueblos cercanos, orografía, etc.

Por supuesto, como es habitual en el resto de libros del juego, se incluyen dos aventuras listas para ser jugadas. La primera, titulada "Los Escudos Blancos" presentará a los héroes a un peculiar clan escondido en lo más recóndito de las montañas y que, entre sus muchos secretos, custodian un antiguo y valioso tesoro. Esta aventura se puede jugar de forma independiente o bien dentro de la campaña oficial.

La segunda aventura es "El Hierro y la Sangre" y es la continuación de la campaña iniciada en el libro básico y que ha ido avanzando en cada uno de los suplementos publicados. Nuestros héroes deberán acudir a la emblemática ciudad de Uppsala donde se verán envueltos de sus misterios, intrigas y aventuras, para terminar con un épico final entre sus murallas.

English translation:

Supplement for RPG Yggdrasill. Detail information about the legendary and mythological city of Uppsala, capital of the kingdom of Sweden, home of the dreaded Sorcerers Kings, descendants of the god Freyr is detailed. Among its pages you will find lots of information about the city, its inhabitants, their customs, nearby towns, topography, etc..

Of course, as usual in other books of the game, two ready to play adventures are included. The first, entitled "White Shield" will feature the heroes to a peculiar clan hidden in the recesses of the mountains, which among its many secrets, guarding an ancient treasure. This adventure can be played independently or within the official campaign.

The second story is "The Iron and Blood" and it is the continuation of the initiated one in the basic book that has been followed in each one of the supplements published. Our heroes must visit the emblematic city of Uppsala where will be involved in its mysteries, intrigues and adventures, to finish with a final epic within its walls.

160690.name: Mar en Calma
160690.description:
From the back of the book:'

Durante el otoño, las gentes del clan Kjari dedican todos sus esfuerzos a almacenar provisiones para los duros inviernos del norte. Los cazadores aprovechan los últimos días cálidos mientras que los pescadores echan sus redes en los fiordos cercanos. Sin embargo, un nuevo problema amenaza la supervivencia de los intrépidos Kjari cuando el vecino clan Egebjerg reclama el caladero del fiordo de Holckenhavn expulsando a los pescadores Kjari con violencia. Ambos clanes habían sido aliados en el pasado y el fiordo se había considerado terreno neutral. Hasta ahora...

Mar en Calma es una aventura sencilla para un grupo de 4 a 6 jugadores. Aunque está pensada para jugarse con los arquetipos descritos en el manual básico de Yggdrasill puede jugarse sin problemas con otro grupo de personajes.

English Translation:

During the fall, the people of the clan Kjari dedicate all their efforts to store provisions for the harsh winters of the north. The hunters take advantage of the last warm days while fishermen cast their nets in nearby fjords. However, a new problem threatens the survival of Kjari intrepid clan when the neighbor clan Egebjerg calls the fishery Holckenhavn fjord expelling violently to the fishermen Kjari. Both clans had been allies in the past and the fjord was considered neutral ground. Until now ...

Calm Sea is a simple adventure for a group of 4-6 players. Though intended to be played with the archetypes described in the basic manual of Yggdrasill it can be played smoothly with another group of characters.

160691.name: Goosebumps: Enter HorrorLand
160691.description:
The website EnterHorrorLand.com is a "gameplay experience which immerses fans in HorrorLand itself". It is based around twelve map sections corresponding to each HorrorLand book, each of which includes numerous mini-games. The premise of each map section is that the antagonist of the corresponding book is trying to take over that area of HorrorLand; the minigames tell the story of each antagonist's defeat by the player. Strangely, the player is frequently represented by Mr. Wood, the main antagonist from Night of the Living Dummy. Guidance and help is provided by the automated fortune teller named Madame Doom.

Source: Wikipedia, "Goosebumps HorrorLand", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

160692.name: The Animal Farm
160692.description:
The Animal Farm is a team competitive board game based on an animal farm where team must try to enclose animal in our fence , collect and sell resources to be the winner .

The Animal Farm is a 2v2 or 1v1 game that will prove your ability to understand your partner's strategy without talking to him. In the meantime, you must protect yourself from the other team that attempts to overthrow your plans.

A game of The Animal Farm is divided in 20 rounds, each one consisting of four turns. Every turn, a player can perform one action: Play an Action Card , Draw some Action Cards , use Nursery to create a new animal, put a wood fence on the board (here players can enclose available animals), collect a resource generated by an owned animals or go to the market where they can sell resources or satisfy orders.

By selling goods or satisying orders in the market, a player collects Victory Point for his team. At the end of the game, the team that has the most Victory Point wins the game.

160693.name: Crush! Deluxe
160693.description:
From the Game Box

Crush is an exciting turn-based strategy sports game, of mayhem and carnage, set far into the future. Eight different alien life forms battle humans through labyrinth-like arenas, in a frantic search for the B.A.L.L. (Bionic Augmented Lower Life form). The first team to find the B.A.L.L. and reach the goal, wins! League Play allows coaches to play consecutive seasons with the same team. The league consists of 12 teams and includes end of season play-offs. Coaches will be able to guide their players development converting their raw experience into various skills and abilities as their players progress from mere rookies to living legends. Players will also age and, should they live long enough, eventually retire. Over time a coach's players may develop unusual "quirks". These range from the harmlessly amusing (fear of foot pads) to the downright annoying (involuntary molecular displacement).
• Head-to-head play via LAN, Internet, and null-modem.
• Turn-based play concentrating on strategy and tactics.
• Extensive player coaching capabilities.
• Play single games or participate in League Play over several seasons.
• Various alien life forms and of course humans, play against each other.
• Individual player stats and attitudes.
• Uses Microsoft DirectX.

160694.name: The Mechanical Woodsman and Other Stories
160694.description:
From the intro:
