The Mechanical Woodsman and Other Stories is a collection of scenarios for any d20 fantasy campaign, and for a variety of power levels.
Each story can be told in one session, and each features elements of clockwork-based magic.
Most players are unfamiliar with such magic, being more used to orcs and dragons and other threats of the flesh. Consider these stories an interesting detour into wind-up fantasy.

160695.name: Titans of Empyrean
160695.description:
There are worlds that are ruled by creatures of the sky, great beasts of mythology that have never known anything but dominance. Generations ago, a rift opened up between these worlds and they became infested with invisible portals that led from one to the other but not necessarily back. The result was a macrocosm that could not be mapped and in which no one could settle. Now, thrust together, these great creatures have been locked in an infinite war, for each species believes that it is its world that is the primary and its right to take control of the new Empyrean.

As a player of Titans of Empyrean, you control a squad of 4 titans placed on a tiny hex battlefield in the sky. Every moving, it is your responsibility to maneuver your titans into positions of opportunity and advantage. Each unique titan has its own special ability and is armed with a deck of maneuver cards for use throughout the game. But be careful. While these powerful maneuvers can be the key to victory, they also double as lifeblood of your titans. Without them, your titan's wounds cannot be healed.

Position your titans.

Manage your maneuvers.

Attack!

Will your titans control the new Empyrean?

160696.name: Super KGB: The KGB meets the CIA in 2 Spy Training Games
160696.description:
Super KGB contains both Project CIA: The Secret Formula and Project KGB: The Double Agent.

Called "Spy Training Games", they were originally issued in 1973 by House of Games Corporation Limited (Bramalea, Ontario, Canada). The two board games are distinct, different, and have different rules. The two board games can be united together and played following the instructions as "The Deluxe Game" or "Super KGB".

In "Project CIA: the secret formula", 17 envelopes are scattered in designated spots on the board game. One of the 17 envelopes has the secret formula. By rolling the dice, players move around the board game and as they pass over the positions where the envelopes are, they pick up the tile and see if it has the secret formula printed on the bottom of the tile. The winner of the game is the one that exits the board game from one of its four entrance/exit gates.

There is a clear moving piece representing a security guard that moves around from one room to another room. If a player finds himself inside a room with the security guard, he/she has one turn to exit the room.

In Game 2, you're either an agent trying to identify the double agent, or you're the latter, sabotaging the training camp. Deception and deduction will keep you scrambling!

Super KGB is what you get when you combine both games 1 and 2. Waddingtons included extra pieces in both sets so you could play a Deluxe version of either game using both boards. Super KGB can be played by up to six, whereas the component games are limited to four.

This is the version from Waddington's with both games in one box.

160697.name: Athenaeum Arcane Letters
160697.description:
From the intro:

The items contained in this PDF are letters from various periods in a generic fantasy setting and are intended to spice up treasure hordes, spur player characters toward their next quest, or simply provide a measure of verisimilitude to the GM’s world.
Each entry includes a physical description, the entire letter, and any relevant background information and notes. Use these letters as is, or let them goad your imagination to create new ones.

160698.name: Circuits
160698.description:
Simple in concept, but very challenging and rewarding, Circuits is a puzzle game that requires listen carefully to complete each level.

The goal of Circuits : reconstruct the different parts of an sliced song. that easy ( or not )

As we love music, we want to make a game that approaches in some way the music creation to players, and that make the listening be a core part of the experience. Packed with beautiful designed minimal graphics, to not disturb the focus of the game, and right now 25 different songs that the player need to reconstruct.

So if you like music, you will like Circuits.

Source: The Developer Website.

160699.name: Unearthed: Trail of Ibn Battuta – Episode 1
160699.description:
When fortune hunter Faris Jawad and his sister Dania receive a call to visit Morocco they embark on an exotic adventure throughout the middle east on the trail of the famous Muslim explorer Ibn Battuta. The trail won't be clear however as Faris will have to overcome an unholy alliance of a militia army leader, a weapons dealer and a wealthy antiquities smuggler who are after the same goal.

Features:
Travel across the Middle East from the wild life of Moroccan Atlas mountains to the alleys of old Damascus through the port of Alexandria and the metropolitan city of Dubai.
Unique mix of platforming, melee fighting, shooting and stealth gameplay.
Presented in a TV style episodic format along with recaps of previous episodes and teaser cliff hangers of what lies ahead.

Source: The Game Website.

160700.name: Cognition Episode 3: The Oracle
160700.description:
When a trail of clues — and bodies — lead Erica to the luxurious Enthon Towers, her post-cognitive powers leave her unable to escape the dark betrayals in its past. The shocking truth about the Oracle’s identity is revealed, along with the killer’s connection to Erica’s own tragic past. No longer sure who she can trust, if anyone, Erica is determined to find the truth, no matter what the cost.

Source: The Developer Website.

160701.name: Cognition Episode 4: The Cain Killer
160701.description:
In the intense finale of Cognition, the Cain Killer resurfaces and Erica must work with someone she cannot trust to finish what she started three years ago. But when the time comes to face her brother’s murderer, what lines will Erica be willing to cross? Which will she choose: justice or revenge?

Source: The Developer Website.

160702.name: Lost Civilization
160702.description:
After making an important discovery, your archaeologist fiance Michael is kidnapped in Prague. Clues indicate that the kidnappers want whatever is it he's found and will stop at nothing to get it. Your search for Michael reveals that underlying all the trouble is an ancient machine—possibly alien in origin—that's been a source of conflict dating back to World War II.

You also learn that in the wrong hands, this machine could destroy the entire human race. Explore more than 120 richly detailed and animated scenes set in Prague, England and Mexico.

Enjoy an evocative soundtrack as you interact with more than 30 characters. Solve fascinating, moderately-challenging puzzles, uncover the earth-shattering secrets hidden in a forgotten mine, and tap into your inner heroine in this magnificent hidden object adventure.

Intense storytelling
120+ richly detailed and animated scenes
30+ interactive characters

Source: The Publisher Website.

160703.name: Arkandian Legends: Chapter II – Revenant
160703.description:
User Summary

The second chapter in the Arkandian Legends series. Arkandian Revenant is an RPG. You quest through various dungeons and other locations, find equipment and loot, and level-up as you go. Your overall aim is to defeat the Revenant.

160704.name: Reperfection - Volume 1
160704.description:
User Summary

Ben hopes to preventing the death of his wife in this story about switching to the perspectives of other characters.

160705.name: Vampires!
160705.description:
Vampires! is an offbeat action puzzle game, filled with vampires, traps, crazy Transylvanian music and fun.

In short, it’s a comedy puzzler where non-glittering drunken bobbleheaded ignorants meet reversed tower defense. Vampires! are a genre mix where strategy, puzzle and action meet fun and frustration. The goal of the game is to guide those bobbleheads through labyrinth and into their crypts while avoiding obstacles, traps and vampire hunters on the way.

It’s almost dawn and vampires are returning into their coffins for a well-deserved sleep after a long night. Time is ticking until the dawn and they’ve discovered that a bunch of vampire slayers got there first and set up traps! Now it’s up to you to use your supernatural powers of tile rotation, garlic-based repellent and spider net slow-down, to help them overcome all obstacles and reach their regular daily rest.

How does the game play?
Your main objective is to save vampires by leading them safely through the labyrinth and into their crypts. To do so, you can rotate the labyrinth parts to create new paths or use garlic-based repellent and spider-net slowdown to prevent vampires from walking into peril. Many traps are indeed lurking for the poor vampires. Starting with simple ones like pure light, things get more complicated down the road. Mobile wooden stakes, silver gun bullets, hired assassins or crazy garlic sappers wait impatiently to vaporize your vampires once for all.

Do you think you’ve mastered the game already? Wait! There’s more. Each non-tutorial level can be completed with additional objectives to earn silver or even gold status. And rest assured that the gold status will not be easy.

What’s in the game?
• 65 challenging levels
• Over 12 hours of gameplay on basic mode with a strong replayability factor
• 6 different types of vampires, each with their own behavior
• Various offbeat traps including mobile wooden stakes, rotating mirrors
• Vampire hunters and garlic sappers hot on your track
• 3 degrees of level completion targeted at casual and hardcore players alike
• 4 different environment types
• Special skills of garlic repellent and spider-net slowdown
• Interactive tutorials

Source: The Developer Website.

160706.name: Hades Nebula
160706.description:
From Wikipedia: Hades Nebula is a 1987 Commodore 64, ZX Spectrum and Atari ST game by Nexus Information Systems. It is a vertical-scrolling space shooter. The player controls an upgradable fighter that must battle its way through thousands of enemy ships before it confronts the last boss, Emperor Hades. There are fifteen levels in this game.

Source: Wikipedia, "Hades Nebula," available under the CC-BY-SA License.


User Summary: The game was developed by Paranoid Software; Commodore 64 version was programmed by Mark Greenshields, graphics by Ned Langman, and with music by W.E.Music ltd. (Ben Daglish). The ZX Spectrum version was programmed by Mike Leaman, and with music by David Whittaker. The Atari ST version was programmed by Kyle Rose, Darren Melbourne and Darren Pegg, graphics by Ned "Paranoid" Langman, music by Ladislav John Brozovsky, and Sound FX by John Wylie.

160708.name: Scooby-Doo and Scrappy-Doo
160708.description:
From the back cover:

"You play the part of Scrappy-Doo in this arcade style platform game. Make your way through four levels of intrigue and mystery in search of Scooby and Shaggy, avoiding all sorts of nasties and baddies."

From the inside cover:

"Another wild and exciting adventure is about to begin for Scooby, Scrappy, Shaggy and the rest of the gang. Shaggy has followed Scooby, who with his everlasting urge for food has decided to wander off in search of a quick snack.

After a time the gang notice that both Scooby and Shaggy are missing and become deeply concerned. As quick as a flash, Scrappy-Doo springs into action volunteering to go and find them.

The search begins...."

160709.name: Assault Machine
160709.description:
User Summary
Assault Machine is a action Adventure game. The aim is trying to destroy the enemy on planet Targon, before the enemy (the AI) is destroying the player (the Galactic Police). The player controls four different droid-agents, named Bond, Chan, Holmes and Chan.

On a map the player chose which island to place a droid on. Flight over sea with the spaceship, trying to fly to a island.
Flight over the island with the spaceship, trying to fly to the drop zone, dropping a droid. Leaving the island.

After the droid is leaved on a island, is will be ambushed by Targons army, and the droid must use missiles to defend it self.

The player can then go back and pick the droid up again, and destroy all buildings (weapon complex) on the island. If not all the buildings are destroyed during a raid, the player can do the mission again trying to take out the remaining buildings.

After all buildings on all ten islands are destroyed, the player wins.

160710.name: Map Rally
160710.description:
From the rear page of the manual:

"Effective simulation of a Car Rally....Map Rally is an enjoyable set of programs suitable for children aged between seven and thirteen. There are full instructions which guide the user simply but effectively." Educational Computing

From the description page inside the manual:

"Somewhere on a grid are three hidden checkpoints. The navigator can only give the rough direction in which they lie. The car is moved across the grid by giving instructions as to where it needs to go to. When the checkpoint is found, the player must check in. A player can race against the clock or two cars can race against each other. Children soon become used to using co-ordinates and compass directions to control the cars.

The program records the time and number of moves taken. After the rally, the children can watch the cars drive around each route taken showing how well each car did."

160711.name: Centauri Knights d20 System
160711.description:
From back cover:

Centauri Knights is the story of Earth's first interstellar colony on Alpha Centauri, the discovery of enigmatic alien ruins, and the struggle that ensued over their control.

Centauri Knights is the sequel to the adventure "Red Planet, Blue Helmets" that was featured in the BESM sourcebook "Big Robots, Cool Starships"

160712.name: Games Review (Volume 2, Issue 10 - Jul 1990)
160712.description:
Contents


Editorial
News


Role Playing


Ars Magica and Covenants (Lion Rampant)
Priest's Handbook (TSR)
GURPS Fantasy (Steve Jackson Games)
Lost Ships and Skull & Crossbows (TSR)
Storm Riders (TSR)
Buck Rogers: XXVc (TSR)
Timelords (BTRC)
The Living Land and The Destiny Map (West End)
GURPS Cyberpunk (Steve Jackson)
Bottled Demon (FASA)
Shadow Elves (TSR)


Wargames


Modern Naval Battles II (3W)
Bloody 110 (The Gamers)
August Fury (The Gamers)


Science Fiction and Fantasy Boardgames


Technical Readouts 2750 & 3050 (FASA)
Escape from the Death Star (West End Games)


Computer Games


Rorkes Drift (Impressions)
Star Flight (Electronic Arts)
Gravity


Miniatures Rules


Ironclads and Ether Flyers (GDW)




Charts
Letters
Back Issues
Subscription

160714.description:
Spurs and Sprockets: Revolutionary Decks is a stand alone game for 2-3 players. It includes 3 new Spurs and Sprockets decks and a new set of rules that will allow players to combine it with the basic Spurs and Sprockets decks to allow for 4, 5 and 6 players to play at the same time. The game decks also include artwork used with the new Flanking rules.

Spurs and Sprockets is a perfect information, abstract strategy game. Players have eight matching tiles that they take turns placing orthogonally into a grid, in an attempt to link three or four in a row. There is no board in Spurs and Sprockets so the grid grows organically, based on the placement of tiles. The grid also varies in size and dimensions based on the number of players.

Spurs and Sprockets sets comes with sixteen tiles and rules for many different ways of playing, ranging from a simple Tic-Tac-Toe-like game where players gain 8 points for four in a row and 3 points for each set of three in a row, to a game where every placement of a tile may result in an attack and removal of another tile.
160714.name: Spurs and Sprockets: Revolutionary Decks

160715.name: Novus Fantasy Roleplaying Game
160715.description:
From the back of the book:

Novus is a brand new role-playing game from Firehawk Games.
Firehawk Games did not set out to re-invent the fireball, it tried to make a fun and flexible game that can easily be adapted to many different styles of role-playing and many different settings. Firehawk Games wants to give you an old school experience with modern, up to date rules, and we believe that Novus fits the bill perfectly.

With Novus, everything you need to start gaming is in one small book.
• 6 Player Races - All of the classics; Human, Elves, Dwarves, Halflings, Half-Elf and Half-Orc.

• 8 Backgrounds - Everything from Barbarian to Upper Class Urban.

• 8 Character Classes - Each Class has some degree of customizability allowing for each character to be unique. The 2 Mage Classes allow for up to 21 different types of Mages, each as customizable as the other Classes.

The Archer, Fighter, Martial Artist, Minstrel, & Dual Mage are just a few of the possibilities.

• Dozens of Spells - Spread among 6 Schools of Magic and the Universal Spells, that any character is able to learn.

• 40+ Monsters - including Demons, Devils, Dragons, Undead and many more, all waiting to be unleashed.

• Snag & Boons - This allows you, the player, to take controls of your character’s own destiny when it comes to fumbles, failures and exceptional successes.

160716.name: Monopoly

videogameversion.243023: English / UK Amstrad CPC 3" Disk edition

160716.description:
From the back of the box:

The Computer Edition of Waddingtons Monopoly.

Can you make more money than the computer? Dare you enter the world of high finance and property speculation? Will the return on your investments in houses and hotels pay off - or will you be caught by high rents and be squeezed out of the market?

All your skill, nerve and luck are pushed to their limits as you and your friends play the Computer Edition of WADDINGTONS MONOPOLY.®

Enjoy hours of challenging, stimulating entertainment while braving the surprises of CHANCE and COMMUNITY CHEST - making or losing a fortune on the roll of the dice!

User Summary

This is an early computer version of Monopoly. It is pretty fully featured, with trading, options for the Short game (time limited) and auctions all implemented.

The game was localised for different markets, with the UK edition using the London board and the French version using the Paris board.

160717.description: Heifer Heist is a family friendly board game that gives a spin on the classic alien-cownapping tale. Aliens who have crash landed on Earth find themselves in a need of organic material to power their tools to fix their ships, and fortunately they've landed in a field of cows! Of course, the farmer isn't pleased about the aliens "borrowing" his cattle. The aliens must dodge the farmer while racing to be the first to gather 10 cows and escape. The players must guide the aliens through the farm, collecting cows and returning them to their own ships. The farm is a set of tiles, initially upside down, which are revealed as the players progress. The game allows for both competitive and cooperative play.
160717.name: Heifer Heist

160719.name: Mind-Stretchers

videogameversion.243037: English / European Amstrad CPC 3" Disk edition

160719.description:
User Summary

This compilation included three classic board games that had been converted to the 8-bit computers by Leisure Genius (Psion in the case of the Spectrum edition of Scrabble).

160720.name: Firewater and Ice
160720.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Ferret has a problem.

A plane carrying a shipment of whiskey, destined for some rich toff, has gone down close to the dreaded Chillwynd Marches. The deadline for delivery is fast approaching and there are others who are interested in the cargo for their own ends. If something isn’t done soon it’ll be disastrous for his future business dealings.

Luckily there’s a crew looking for work.

Firewater and Ice is a short adventure for the Savage Worlds system set in the Diselpunk/Pulp Fantasy frontier setting of Frozen Skies

160723.name: Rough Waters Ahead
160723.description:
Survivors are trying to brave the treacherous waters while stranded in the ocean awaiting their helicopter rescue, are you here to save them? NO! You're here to drown them!

Survivors are held up in a structure and players flick dice at the structure hoping to drown as many as possible.

There are 4 rounds and each person drowned is worth a different amount of points. Score the most points by the end of the 4th round and win the game.

Rough Waters Ahead is a print-on-demand dexterity game available on The Game Crafter's website.

160724.name: Alfred the Great: The Great Heathen Army 871AD – Miniatures Edition
160724.description:
A two player or solitaire game that uses Hex, dice and miniatures, a game with complexity on the lower end of the scale that has the Vikings invading Wessex in 871AD, players will have to consider when and where to fight, re-supply and other challenging factors to win the game.

Players have Warriors, Earls/Jarls and Kings to do battle with and will have to make strategic and tactical choices to win the game.
A turn chart of 15 moves commences in January 871AD and goes through to May 871AD.

The same game as Alfred the Great: The Great Heathen Army 871AD (Counters version) but players purchase their own 1:72 scale figures and plastic counters to make a 3D version of the game. Map will best printed in A3 size to fit miniatures on the board comfortably. UPDATE! this game was originally released as a PNP game but is no longer available, High Flying Dice Games released a hard copy zip lock game :Alfred the Great The Great Heathen Army 871AD http://www.hfdgames.com/alfred.html

160725.name: Business Casual
160725.description:
From the introduction:

“I’m going to need you to work late”

You are an office worker, a corporate scut monkey in a sea of beige cubicles. The conflicts that define your life revolve around petty office politics, pointless projects, and missed deadlines. On a bad day you will be humiliated, abused, and betrayed by people you thought were your friends. On a good day you might get a new pen.

160726.name: Switch & Signal
160726.description: In Switch and Signal, you take the role of engineers, signalmen, switchmen, and yardmasters working together to load trains with cargo, navigate a congested railway network, and deliver cargo to the port city of Savannah, Georgia. Switches and signals are used to guide trains along routes. For every train that reaches the port, you gain victory points. You win the game by gaining at least 40 victory points, and 60 victory points is a perfect game.

160727.description:
Harbour Bridges is a light network connection game featuring a double sided board of Sydney and Auckland Harbours.

Players take on the role of city planners and build bridges to connect cycle routes between harbourside suburbs and then race the other players to get their pawns on to their target suburbs quicker than anyone else.

Movement is by collecting numbered cards, and on movement turns players play down as many cards as they want as long as the cards are the same number.
160727.name: Harbour Bridges

160729.name: Le Terre Perdute
160729.description:
From the blurb (translated):

Those parts of Earth where humankind hasn’t been able to resist the undead awakening are now called «Lost lands» (Italian: terre perdute): these territories are wide-spreading and dangerous, as not only are they roamed by the undead but by wild beasts and ill-willed humans too. Nonetheless, even in the lost lands sparse pockets of safety and groups of mostly nomad friendly people can be found.

160731.description: Age of Steam Expansion: Old Europe / 51st State is a new pair of expansions for use with the Age of Steam base game. Each expansion features a non-hex-based map for use by experienced AoS players.
160731.name: Age of Steam Expansion: Old Europe / 51st State

160732.description:
Age of Steam Expansion: Argentina / The French Riviera is a new pair of expansions for use with Age of Steam. Each new map in this expansion includes a new type of hex, with Argentina featuring the pampas and The French Riviera showcasing the expensive French coast.

Both maps are illustrated by the talented Todd Sanders, who added flavor to them, namely the Dictatorship and Saul Bass film posters.
160732.name: Age of Steam Expansion: Argentina / The French Riviera

160733.description:
Compilation in a box of four Spanish classic games from CEFA:

"Misterio"
The game is about solving the mysterious disappearances by a process of elimination. The winner will be the detective that manages to solve the 3 keys: "Mis" "Te" "Rio"

"Alerta Roja"
During the voyage of the merchant ship that transports barrels with radioactive residue, one of them disappears mysteriously.

By satellite, this barrel, is directed by the sea to a far away city.
Ultimatum: In 48 hours the city will be destroyed!!

The most famous secret agent searches , using the most sophisticated equipment he has. Since the barrel, being moved by computers, can transform itself into the same type of vehicle that the agent uses for his search, the search and recovery becomes an almost impossible mission.

"Imperio Cobra"
The game is a standard roll and move fare with the added twist that one of the gamers controls the forces of evil and attempts to stop all of the other players from winning

"Dagon"
In order to win the game you have to search for the “Dagon Symbol” and carry it to one of the cities. This “Symbol” is in the center of the board.

By doing this you will be invested “Kingdom Knight”.
The first one in being invested as a Knight in three different cities will win the game
160733.name: El Club de la Aventura

160734.name: Protector: Reclaiming the Throne
160734.description:
User Summary

Protector: Reclaiming the Throne, also known as Protector II is the follow-up to Protector. The gameplay remains the same, a twist on tower defence where you must defend a path against waves of enemies who seek to travel from one side of the map to the other. The unit upgrade system has been amended from the first game, and your initial unit choice is now simply mage or warrior, with colour specialisation now chosen via upgrades. The skill tree has also been enlarged and updated. There are 22 levels of increasing difficulty to play through, these becoming unlocked as you progress through the game via a world map.

160735.name: A Lucky Morning
160735.description:
From publisher blurb:

When the heroes awaken to find themselves the only survivors of a bizarre mass murder, they alone can hunt the monstrous perpetrator. Hot on the trail, the PCs attempt to keep the body count from rising while uncovering a dastardly scheme. Can the PCs connect the clues before the vengeful plot consumes the entire town?

"A Lucky Morning" also contains an eight-page gazetteer of Thaven, the setting for this adventure and a vibrant town suitable for use in any game world.

"A Lucky Morning" is an urban adventure for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. Presented for PCs of 2nd or 3rd level, this adventure also contains notes and statistics for scaling challenges to PCs for higher or lower level. The adventure features numerous player handouts and clues, pregenerated characters, an urban gazetteer, and a file containing 1-inch square maps of all encounter areas ready for printing. "A Lucky Morning" is written by Ron Lundeen, with maps by Blake Wilkie and Tamas Baranya and art by Blake Wilkie and Maciej Zagorski.

160736.name: Stupid & Overpowered 4
160736.description:
From publisher blurb:

Characters in rpgs often have abilities are not tied to their class, race or skill, although they may be related/useful to it. These are called Feats.

They may be combat related, a way to tweak spells or even to do with the crafting of an item. Some will be useful to almost everyone, others only in very certain circumstances.

This edition of “Fantastic Feats” – a series of feats based around a certain theme or subject – is about more stupid & overpowered feats meant for light-hearted fun games and over the top (N)Pcs, especially those who enjoy eating or drinking.

Feats you will find within:

Alcoholic Tolerance - Be able to drink stronger beverages
Flip ‘n’ Catch - Food go up, come down into your mouth
Gagging-b-Gone - Only got a mouldy steak to eat? This feat will stop you from gagging as you do!
Iron Stomach - That mouldy steak not settling well? This will stop you from being violently ill
Refined Palette - Be able to identify food and drink from the smallest sample
Spice Tolerance - You can eat spicy food that would make a fire elementalsay "ooh thats hot"
Stuff Face - Become a humanoid hamster and fill your cheeks

160737.name: Mythic Martial Arts II
160737.description:
From publisher blurb:

The 22nd in our new series of Mythic Minis, Mythic Martial Arts II brings you 6 mythic feats for your monastic and martial masters of mayhem, including the Boar Style and Crane Style feat chains made mythic!

160738.name: Treasures of Camelot I
160738.description:
From publisher blurb:

Drawing on the rules presented in the Genius Guide to Relics of the Godlings I and II, the Relic Files bring new magic items to your game table. Drawing on historical myth and traditional fantasy tropes, each Relic Files PDF presents a new relic suitable for use in most fantasy campaigns.

Merlin looked hard at Arthur. “Those are precious gifts! Do not treat them lightly, particularly the scabbard.” The King looked perplexed. “The scabbard, Merlin? It
is fine, but surely you don’t suggest that it is superior to Excalibur?”

Merlin snorted. “Of course that is what I meant, foolish boy. That scabbard is worth tenfold that of your precious sword ... Keep that scabbard safe and it will keep you
hale in turn."

160739.name: Treasures of Camelot II
160739.description:
From publisher blurb:

Drawing on the rules presented in the Genius Guide to Relics of the Godlings I and II, the Relic Files bring new magic items to your game table. Drawing on historical myth and traditional fantasy tropes, each Relic Files PDF presents a new relic suitable for use in most fantasy campaigns.

Bedivere stumbled backward, reaching for a discarded goblin blade, but his enemy was faster and kicked the sword out of the knight’s reach ... the goblin was struck midswing by a bolt of lightning. Arthur strode from the smoke. The long curved blade of his enchanted sword, Caladbolg ... crackling with power, was mightier than even the stories claimed.

160740.name: Treasures of Camelot III
160740.description:
From publisher blurb:

Drawing on the rules presented in the Genius Guide to Relics of the Godlings I and II, the Relic Files bring new magic items to your game table. Drawing on historical myth and traditional fantasy tropes, each Relic Files PDF presents a new relic suitable for use in most fantasy campaigns.

Knights of the Pendragon ... there were three of them. “Damnit,” Bror swore. The orc warlord ran forward and bore down on the three knights. Two lowered spears, while the third—the smallest of the three—drew a gladius. An imperial-style shortsword, its blade glimmering with a faint light. The young knight deftly stepped inside the reach of Bror’s longspear and drove his blade deep, biting into the orc’s midsection. Then it came—a command in that soft and weak human tongue. Suddenly, there was blazing light! The knight’s gladius erupted in impossibly brilliant flames.

160741.name: 3RD Power
160741.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the world of Super Science, is everything as it appears?

The heroes, villains, and secret circles of high science get the star treatment in this sourcebook for SUPERS! Revised Edition. Within you'll find:

Details on the group, 3RD Power, including their bios and powers, using them in your campaign, and adjusting them for a villainous option.
Several organizations are detailed including the Prometheus Pact, a group with a milennia old secret forcing them to seek out new technology.
Two plot outlines allowing you to put your players into the action for SCIENCE!

160742.name: The Hetaera
160742.description:
From publisher blurb:

The hetaera tradition is an ancient one, rising out of a desire for beauty and excellence and a taste for sensual pleasures. It is an institution guarded by the noble and the wealthy because it grants access to some of the most interesting men and women in the world. No mere commoner can command a hetaera’s affections, but many visitors at court wish they had a hetaera’s connections. Hetaerae are chosen not only for their breathtaking faces, but also for their ready minds and keen insight. Sometimes fostered as children, they are trained extensively in politics, performance, and magic, so that they can gain and hold the attentions – and the patronage – of the mighty. In so doing, they take on the essence of grace and start to become mighty themselves, and through the assistance of their lovers.

This is a 20-level class for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game.

160743.name: Future Heroes (Fate)
160743.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the extreme future, the galaxy is a crowded place. There are thousands of inhabited worlds and intelligent species, and very few of them get along with each other. But there is one shining example of order and peace.
This is the Federation of Planets, and it is protected by a valiant group of superheroes, who use their incredible powers to defend their future civilization.

Future Heroes is a role-playing game designed to simulate a superhero comic book world of spaceships, robots and superscience. It uses the Fate Core rules, with an innovative system for superpowers added on.

This simple system allows superheroes to be quickly designed, but be every bit as complex and interesting as the heroes of the comic books. So take a look, and blast into a future fit for a superhero.

177801.name: Ether Ore: An Expansion for Far Space Foundry

160744.description:
The Far Space Federation is leading an ongoing peacekeeping mission. The crew on the front lines are in constant need of new supplies and equipment, so the Federation has set up a massive supply line network. This network is composed of massive space stations called Foundries. Some Foundries are specialized in mining and processing ore from asteroids. Other Foundries are equipped with robotic manufacturing and repair facilities. Their job is to keep the flow of supplies going efficiently as possible.

The gameplay in Far Space Foundry occurs in two distinct halves: Space Foundry Alpha and Space Foundry Beta.

At Space Foundry Alpha, you mine skyrite (blue crystals) and rubion (red ore) and process the two to make galactium (purple metal). On your turn, you play a card that allows you to either land a shuttle on a docking bay or take off from one. The shuttle will transport raw materials either from the asteroid or to your freighters. Each docking bay has a special ability if activated that turn, like ore processing or galactic traders. At this foundry, you must also build a fleet of freighters to haul your items. To do this, you must visit the cantina to recruit help from various alien captains (with unique abilities). Once everyone has played all of their cards, it's time to head off to a new board...

At Space Foundry Beta, you take all of your acquired materials and transport them down to the station. There the robots will use that material to make various products of varying worth. Besides manufacturing, you may also upgrade your freighters or charge up your existing products for more points. Once the freighters are filled back up again, it's time to transport the items to their final destination for final scoring!
160744.name: Far Space Foundry

160745.name: Hellfire (1984)
160745.description:
User Summary
Hellfire is a platform game from Melbourne House in 1984.
In the game you play as Odysseus trying to get back to your home island. On the way Odysseus need to pass by mountains, temples and mazes, and avoid monsters and minotaurs. The game goes from screen to screen, and involves some jumping. Some screen are seen from the side, some in a 3D perspective.

160746.description:
Objective: be the first reaching space 42
- moving by turns -

Simple 'Roll & Move' game; choose one of three different routes before you start; there in no space '1' on the board - you must roll at least a '2' getting started. Ending on a red marked space follow instructions glued into the lid.

Note:
Published likely early 1920s.
160746.name: Bergreise Ein neues Würfelspiel

160747.description:
Objective:
Be the first reaching space 100
- moving by turns -

Simple 'Roll&Move' game; ending on a red or blue marked space follow instructions.

Note:
Likely published mid 1920s.
160747.name: Töff-Töff!

160748.name: Todd Parr's I'm Going on a Trip...A Worldly Game of Travel and Chance
160748.description:
From the back of the box:

Grab your bag and get ready...You're going on a trip! How many places will you travel to and how will you get there? Will you go to the mountains or a tropical island? Will you visit a museum or an amusement park? Each time you reach one of your travel destinations, you collect a souvenir to pack in your suitcase. Whoever packs their suitcase fastest is the winner!

The suspense builds as players draw chance cards and use clever strategy to collect their souvenirs before other players get theirs. One bad move can change the outcome, so it's a race to the finish to see who will win!

Object of the Game:
Players travel the game board hoping to collect the Souvenirs and Transportation cards they need to fill their suitcases. The first player to finish packing his or her own suitcase wins the game!

160749.name: RuneQuest Essentials
160749.description:
From the book's introduction:

This edition of RuneQuest is a heavily edited and pared-down version of the full rulebook. Although the core of the system is intact, this Essentials Edition is intended to be a sampler for the main rules and, hopefully, encourage players and Games Masters to invest in the full game. For example, we have only included two of the five magic systems; we have also left out the extensive chapter concerning cults and brotherhoods, and have provided only a fraction of the creatures. Nevertheless, there is enough here to get started and, indeed, enjoy many hours of adventure. At some stage though, you will, we hope, want more, and be curious and eager enough to buy the RuneQuest 6th Edition core rules so that you can take advantage of the complete system in all its glory.

From the publisher's web site:

This special version of RuneQuest 6th Edition is designed to introduce players and Games Masters to the essentials of the game. In this book you will find the core of the RuneQuest engine, in a stripped-down format, but still complete enough to create characters and begin adventuring with one of roleplaying’s most enduring and respected systems.

The intention is that this book will give you a taste of the mechanics and encourage you to move onto the full edition of the rules. The full rulebook contains much, much more: more game options, more magic, more monsters more cults.

160750.name: Arkandian Legends: Chapter I – Crusade
160750.description:
User Summary

Arkandian Legends: Chapter I - Crusade, or Arkandian Crusade for short, is an RPG set in the world of Arkandia. You explore dungeons and fight evil doers, acquire loot, craft items and learn spells. As well as one-to-one combat using simulated dice rolling mechanics, there are also battlefield levels where the combat is tactical.

160751.description:
"Viajar a lo largo de una provincia de Cuba designada, respondiendo correctamente preguntas de seis diferentes categorias. Para ganar, un jugador (o equipo) debera llegar al puerto despues de responder correctamente cuatro preguntas de la categoria "No!" consecutivas."

Translation:
Tourism along a designated province of Cuba, correctly answering questions in six different categories. To win, a player (or team) must reach the port after correctly answering four questions of the category "No!" consecutively.
160751.name: Ay mi Cuba!

160752.name: Play Golf - Pineview
160752.description:
From the game instructions

Designed to be the most realistic computer golf game available Three views of each hole, Overhead and side views of shots, Augmented color graphics, Complete bag of clubs, Hooks and Slices, Non-level greens, Trees, Bushes, Water, Rough and Sand.

1 to 4 players can play from Regular or Championship tees.

Before you can hit your shot you have to make the same decisions that you have to make on the golf course: What direction to hit the ball, Which club to use, how hard to swing and whether to hook or slice the ball. you enter these decisions by selecting one character commands and keying in your choices.

All the games in the Golf's Best/Play Golf series have the same features, use the same control scheme and have very similar graphics. They are all stand alone games that feature different real world courses.

160755.name: Cardian
160755.description:
User Summary

Cardian is a tower defense game in the guise of a collectible card game. You first build your deck from the starter packs and booster cards screens, then battle commences and a selection of your cards is drawn at random. You must defend your portal and launch an assault on the enemy portal using the cards drawn, some of which will summon troops, some will bring status effects into play and others will help you accumulate resources. If you succeed in defeating the enemy you gain a reward in gold, and more card packs can be bought.

160756.name: Frida's Fruit Fiesta Game
160756.description:
Learn letters with Frida! It’s lunchtime in the rainforest and Frida is collecting letters for her little ones. Spin, find, squeeze, and set four letters in a row first to win this fruity preschool letter game. For 2-4 players.

Teaches letters and the alphabet
Develops fine motor skills
Develops strategic thinking skills
Encourages social skills and turn-taking

Alphabet game for preschoolers

160757.name: The Sneaky Snacky Squirrel Card Game
160757.description:
Your furry forest friends are hungry and they need your help! Race the other players to squirrel away the most acorn cards and you win this nutty, fast-action, color-matching game for preschoolers.

Reinforces color learning
Develops matching, sorting, and strategic thinking skills
Encourages social skills and turn-taking
Practices memory and attention skills

Preschool color matching game
Fast-play fun
Based on The Sneaky, Snacky Squirrel game.

160759.name: Reading Roundup
160759.description:
Howdy y’all! It’s a reading race through the southwest! Pick your cards, gallop around the board to round up all your words, and giddy up home before the other players to win! Game features the top 25 building block words.

Teaches 25 key Kindergarten words.

160760.name: Arkandian Legends: Chapter III – Explorer
160760.description:
User Summary

Arkandian Legends: Chapter III - Explorer (also known as Arkandian Explorer is the third game in the Arkandian Legends series. You are exploring The Border Isles, an area previously isolated from the world by a magic shield that has now fallen. You progress through the game by clearing dungeons of enemies or finding items and gold, and as you level-up you gain access to harder levels and better equipment. If you are able to finish the game using a basic class, other classes become available. Changes from the previous game in the series include an autocombat option and a more versatile spell casting system.

160761.name: Halo: The Master Chief Collection

videogamehonor.30525: 2014 The Game Awards Best Remaster of the Year Nominee

160761.description:
User Summary

Halo: The Master Chief Collection includes all four Halo games in their entirety along with every map and every gameplay mode for each individual game. All content from all the games will be unlocked from the start, and the game will feature Mission Setlists, which will be curated playlists of particular moments from across the entire franchise. The collection will also ship with Halo Nightfall (a digital series produced by Ridley Scott) that will lead into Halo 5 and will be given access to the Halo 5 beta. The games will all run in 1080p at 60 fps.

The included Halo: Combat Evolved Anniversary is a brand-new version of the first Halo game and will feature entirely redone graphics as well as redone CG cinematics.

160762.description:
In feudal Japan, Spring is a time of great celebration, but while everyone is distracted gazing at the flowers blooming, the Oni, twisted and legendary creatures, watch from the forest thinking of new mischief to do. They have gathered for an unique tournament: they will challenge each other to see who can make more people stumble and fall without being noticed in return for gold. Beware though! Samurai look after this place, and no one has brought them down before. Challenge your friends to get more gold, but keep an eye on your mischievous friends, since not even your own gold will be safe!

Oni is quick party game of memory and deception, every player has an objective to attack and they are mixed with samurais forming a circle in the table. Every turn they will move one place, you will have to remember his position, hunt him, bring it in front of you and make it fall, before someone else does.
160762.name: Oni

160763.name: Halo 5: Guardians

videogamehonor.33267: 2015 CVA Best International Game of the Year Nominee

160763.description:
User Summary

Halo 5: Guardians is the next installment in the Halo franchise.

160764.name: ScaleBound

videogamehonor.38790: 2016 Golden Joystick Most Wanted Game Next Year Nominee

160764.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development.




User Summary

ScaleBound is an xbox one exclusive that features various monsters being fought by dragon riders.

160765.name: The Kobolds of  Tzarker Mines
160765.description:
From publisher blurb:

Adventure as a Kobold!

Ever wondered what it’s like from the kobold’s side of the game table? Here’s your chance to find out! The Kobolds of Tzarker Mines live a gloomy existance deep in the mountains mining treasure for a volcano dragon. When disaster strikes, can you save your tribe from a fiery doom?

This 36-page Pathfinder Compatible adventure is designed for four level 1 kobold characters, and will bring them to level 3 if they survive to the end of their adventures.

160766.name: Rise of the Tomb Raider

videogameexpansion.210506: Rise of the Tomb Raider - Baba Yaga: The Temple of the Witch

videogamehonor.33267: 2015 CVA Best International Game of the Year Nominee

videogamecompilation.210508: Rise of the Tomb Raider: 20 Year Celebration

160766.description:
User Summary

Players will once again take on the role of Lara Croft and presumably explore an underground city.

160767.name: Hermetic
160767.description:
User Summary
Hermetic is a video game from 1993. The story is about the energy on the planet Hermetic, it is soon gone, the planet is using the last reserves. A troop is sent out to "unknown galaxies" in search for energy. One of the troopers (the player) is reading about a casino-planet called Haag, in a newspaper at a pub onboard a space station. With the leaders of Hermetic's approval, the trooper bet the homeplanet for energy. You now have to play H.A.M.M. (Haag's Agressive Maneuver Moon), six tunnels with robots programmed to kill. Just a few have survived it. Hermetic is a side-scrolling shoot'em up in space, with six levels, each ending with a boss fight. After each level the player, visiting a bar in the spacestation of H.A.M.M., and can play one of three classix arcade games (minigame-clone of Pac-Man, Space Invaders, or Breakout), that can give the player extra life.

160768.name: Dark Souls II - The Crown of the Sunken King

videogamehonor.35052: 2014 Global Game Awards Best Expansion of the Year Nominee

videogamecompilation.170668: Dark Souls II: Scholar of the First Sin

160768.description:
User Summary

Dark Souls II the Lost Crowns is a three part quest for a lost crown. The trilogy takes players through all new areas filled with new monsters and environments. You’ll traverse underground pyramids, and snow-swept vistas.

The Crown of the Sunken King is part one of the trilogy.

160769.name: Dark Souls II - The Crown of the Old Iron King

videogamehonor.33341: 2015 SXSW Best Add-On Content of the Year Nominee

videogamecompilation.170668: Dark Souls II: Scholar of the First Sin

160769.description:
User Summary

Dark Souls II the Lost Crowns is a three part quest for a lost crown. The trilogy takes players through all new areas filled with new monsters and environments. You’ll traverse underground pyramids, and snow-swept vistas.

The Crown of the Old Iron King is part two of the trilogy.

160770.name: Dark Souls II - The Crown of the Ivory King

videogamehonor.34137: 2014 Operation Rainfall Awards Best DLC/Expansion of the Year Nominee

videogamecompilation.170668: Dark Souls II: Scholar of the First Sin

160770.description:
User Summary

Dark Souls II the Lost Crowns is a three part quest for a lost crown. The trilogy takes players through all new areas filled with new monsters and environments. You’ll traverse underground pyramids, and snow-swept vistas.

The Crown of the Ivory King is part three of the trilogy.

160771.name: Der große Krieg
160771.description:
Objective: Be the first reaching space 100
- moving by turns -

All players have to buy in first. Each player moves forward according die roll. Ending on certain spaces you must pay or collect play money, skip a turn or move again...

Note:
Likely published 1916 +/- one year.

169775.name: First to Fight: Wehrmacht / Gestapo Promo

160773.description:
The title of First to Fight refers to the famous slogan and poster distributed in European countries after Poland was the first country to be attacked by Germany in September 1939. This game, released by Fabryka Gier Historycznych (Historical Games Factory)in cooperation with Fundacja Niepodległości (Foundation for Independence), takes place throughout the entirety of World War II, with the players taking the roles of commanders of the Polish forces that are fighting on numerous fronts: Eastern and Western Europe, Africa, etc. By allocating their troops in different regions of the world, they aim to carry out missions (including the most famous battles of WW2) and earn victory points (VPs). The players do not "own" or control the soldiers, which are represented by neutral cards, moved by the players around the board, and activated only when it is the time to play a mission card in a given region; that said, their particular specialization may increase a player's chance to win a mission. The player with the most VPs at the end of the War (May 1945) wins.

The game presents true historical characters, events and places. First to Fight shows the scale of various activities that took place during the war – but it is not a wargame. Over its 40-70 minute playing time, a player will get to know many people and places that played an important role in achieving the victory over Germany. Among the soldiers to command, you can find Antoni Chruściel ps. Monter, August Emil Fieldorf ps. Nil, Jan Kozielewski ps. Jan Karski, Zdzisław Jeziorański ps. Jan Nowak, Stanisław Maczek ps. Baca, Jan Piwnik ps. Ponury, Zofia Rapp-Kochańska ps. Marie Springer, Stanisław Skalski, Elżbieta Zawacka ps. Zo, Witold Urbanowicz ps. Kobra. In order to win the game, you will have to train your soldiers and send them to various fronts – from the cold regions of Northern Europe, through the sun-baked deserts of Northern Africa and peaceful (only in theory!) Western Europe, to Warsaw, always fighting to the last bullet and the last soldier! All characters and events presented in the game were real.
160773.name: First to Fight

160774.description:
Objective: be the first reaching space 64
- moving by turns -

Simple 'Roll & Move' game; each player must buy in; ending on a marked space follow instructions glued into the lid:
green - skip one turn; red - earn play money; purple - step 10 spaces forward; blue - step 8 spaces backwards.

Note:
Published likely mid 1930s.
160774.name: Max und Moritz

160775.name: Hyperrace
160775.description:
User Summary
Hyperrace is a action game from Ariolasoft in 1987. The screen in the game is divided in two, upper and lower section, and in each section you see a spaceship flying. The player controls one of the spaceships trying to shot down the other space ship. The second ship can be controlled by a second player. The graphics in the game reminds a lot of the game Uridium.

160777.name: Illgen
160777.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of QIX.





User Summary
Illgen is a video game from 1990. The game is clone of Qix. The theme of the game is space, eg. planets, moons and spaceships.

160778.name: Star Worlds CCG
160778.description:
Star Worlds is a collectible card game, where a player takes a role of a commander of a space fleet.

A player starts the game with a base and 50-card deck. The base can produce certain types of units, which in turn can produce other types of units. In addition to this a player can play characters and put light spaceships directly into play from his or her hand.

Spaceships can be divided into many categories: some of them can attack other spaceships, other recover used cards or cover key units from enemy fire, deliver ammunition onto the battlefield.

Once a player has gathered enough units, he or she can attack their opponent’s base. If the player’s base is destroyed, the other player wins the game. Another way to win the game is to collect twelve strategic points, produced by strategic objects. The third way includes the defense of the base until the opponent will run out of cards in their deck.

The creator and designer of the game is Vladimir Kravchenko.

The first set consists from 110 cards, 55 for each of two factions.

160779.name: Iridis Alpha
160779.description:
User Summary
Iridis Alpha is a action game for the commodore 64 by Jeff Minter. The game is close to a clone of Star Wars: The Empire Strikes Back (from 1982), but with a twist. In this side scrolling game there is two worlds seen at the same time, a mirror world (the opposite side of the planet) and the player can go between the two worlds trying to make progress. The players ship is also mirrored in the other world, and the ship explodes if the player doesn't switch between the two ships often. The aim is to destroy 20 waves of enemies on all parts of the planet. There are 5x2 planet-parts.

160782.name: Jail Break
160782.description:
User Summary
Jail Break (or Jailbreak) is a 1986 arcade game from Konami. The game is side scrolling shoot'em up there the player is a policeman trying to stop a jailbreak, and in the end free the prison wardon. The player has to shoot the prisoners and help hostages. The policeman can found new weapons, like a bazooka. There are five levels in the game: town (Broadway), park (Battery Park, the navy yard, bridge (Manhattan bridge) and prison (Manhattan prison). After beaten the last level the game begins again at the first level with a harder setting. If the game is beaten 20 time, it starts on level one again in the easy setting. The player get bonus points a 3000 pts, and then after each 7000 pts. Two player can play, but not at the same time.

160783.description:
Game description from the publisher:

The legitimate authorities have given way to mob rule — it's anarchy!

Revolution! Anarchy includes a new board overlay, new bidding boards, and two new sets of player components, allowing you to play Revolution! with up to six people. With this expansion, you'll be able to force the Warden to throw your enemies in jail, blackmail the Heretic and take over the asylum, and bribe the Anarchist, whose effects change every turn!
160783.name: Revolution! Anarchy

160784.description:
In Fidelitas, players take on the role of faithful citizens in a medieval city who are exerting influence in order to gain the credibility needed to lead the charge against the corrupt crown.

Players play character cards to various locations that make up the city in order to meet conditions of hidden objectives. Each type of character card is associated with a unique action that manipulates cards in the game: the Butcher bullies other characters to new locations, the Student gains more cards, the Soldier keeps the peasants from loitering too long, etc. In this game where keen maneuvering is key, attentiveness to the opposition may uncover hidden motives that seek to foil your bid for power.

The first player to gain a certain number points (depending on the number of players) is determined worthy to lead the revolt and also wins the game.
160784.name: Fidelitas

160785.name: Tengami
160785.description:
User Summary

Tengami is a typical point-and-click puzzle adventure set in ancient Japan. The game is next to completely textless. The player can interact and sometimes pick up items to proceed in the game. Most puzzles consist of experimenting with, or delicately observing the environment. The goal of the game is to collect cherry blossom petals for the withered tree that is presented at the start of the game.
The graphics are presented in a paper pop-up picture book style; each change of scenery is as if the player turns the pages in a pop-up book, the scenery folds together, and a new scenery rises up.

160786.description:
Clash: Ascension of the Elements – Lightning Expansion adds the element of Lightning to the existing six elements.

Destructive and short lived, lightning seeks to leave its mark on the world by destroying the other elements. In its fury to destroy, Lightning sometimes creates Fire and Light in its wake.
160786.name: Clash: Ascension of the Elements – Lightning Expansion

160787.name: Bloodborne

videogamecompilation.210434: Bloodborne Game of the Year Edition

videogamehonor.31976: 2014 Game Critics Best Role Playing Game of the Year Nominee

160787.description:
User Summary

Bloodborne takes place in the ancient city of Yharnam. It is infected with a spreading, cursed illness, death, and madness. Your job is to discover its secrets and survive.

160788.name: LittleBIGPlanet 3

videogamehonor.30785: 2014 Gamescom Best Family Game of the Year Winner

160788.description:
User Summary

LittleBIGPlanet 3 has more depth between the foreground and background along with new playable characters. One is called Toggle, a bulky sockman who can either use his weight to push things or depress switches, or shrink down really tiny to fit through small gaps. A new ability called the Pumpinator, allows sackboy to blow objects away, aiding his allies and opening up paths.

160789.name: Meanie Rangers
160789.description:
Meanie Rangers is a short, Pokemon style game where players catch Meanies in the wild or duel with other players. Each Meanie appears on a single card with a value of 2-7. After 4 rounds of catching fighting and trading, players are judged on the quality of their entire hand.

Points are allocated for the highest mean score, the highest median, the highest mode and the largest range. The game can be played with POD cards, or with normal playing cards of value 2,3,4,6,7 (one of each suit).

Microgame Contest Entry. Full rules are available for free: See links.

160790.name: No Man's Sky

videogamehonor.31675: 2014 Game Critics Best Graphics, Sound or Innovation of the Year Winner (Innovation)

160790.description:
User Summary

In No Man’s Sky, players will be able to explore planets and solar systems that are randomly generated. Each world has its own ecosystem and players are initially given a totally uncharted universe to explore, where information about any planet's characteristics and lifeforms may be shared and updated with others.

160791.name: ABZÛ

videogamehonor.31996: 2015 Game Critics Best Independent Game of the Year Nominee

160791.description:
User Summary

ABZU follows an explorer journeying through the deep sea.

160792.name: Magicka 2

videogamehonor.34980: 2015 Global Game Awards Best Comedy Game of the Year Nominee

160792.description:
User Summary

The four wizards return in Magicka 2.

160793.name: Magicka: Wizard Wars
160793.description:
User Summary

Magicka: Wizard Wars has humor and the dynamic spell system of Magicka. Players form teams of four and combine magical elements on the fly to create hundreds of spell combinations with wildly varying effects.

160794.name: Entwined
160794.description:
User Summary

Entwined involves a origami bird and fish, one blue and one orange. They are two souls in love but they can't be together. You must bring them together over the course of nine lifetimes, navigating increasingly difficult tunnel levels as you go.

160796.description:
User summary:

The fourth extra Tragedy Set for Tragedy Looper, this is numbered as being "Expansion 0", as it's a "beginners" set. This booklet contains everything needed for a Tragedy Set: Basic Plots, Subplots, Roles and Incidents. Also contains 6 pre-written scripts and script creation hints.

Designed as a beginner's new set, this set is largely based on "Basic Tragedy", with more than half of the hidden roles from Basic Tragedy also existing in this set.

The set's theme is "lies". The protagonists cannot believe everything they are told.
160796.name: Midnight Zone

160797.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Brisbane Broncos, an Australian Footballcub; limited edition to raise money for McGuinness McDermott Foundation (now Little Heroes Foundation).
160797.name: Monopoly: Wow Brisbane Broncos Charity Edition

160798.name: Battle of Monmouth
160798.description: Re-fight the battle that could have ended the American Revolution on a hot summer's day in 1778. Find out if your strategies and maneuvers would have altered the course of battle. You are in command either as General Clinton, or as Generals Lee and Washington. Luck is not a factor.

160799.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Carlton (based in Melbourne), an Australian Footballcub; limited edition to raise money for McGuinness McDermott Foundation (now Little Heroes Foundation).
160799.name: Monopoly: Carlton Football Club 2008 Charity Edition

160800.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Western Australia; limited edition to raise money for McGuinness McDermott Foundation (now Little Heroes Foundation).
160800.name: Monopoly: Icons of Western Australia Charity Edition

160801.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Collingwood, Victoria, an Australian Footballcub; limited edition to raise money for McGuinness McDermott Foundation (now Little Heroes Foundation).
160801.name: Monopoly: Collingwood Football Club 2008 Charity Edition

160802.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Benalla All Blacks, an Australian Footballcub; limited edition to raise money for McGuinness McDermott Foundation (now Little Heroes Foundation).
160802.name: Monopoly: All Blacks Charity Edition

160803.description:
Caverna: LARP and Cosplay Postcard is a small expansion for the Caverna board game that consists of the LARP chamber and the COSPLAY room. Here's how they work:


LARP chamber: You get a weapon 1 chip for one of your dwarves that never will be upgraded.



Cosplay room: During scoring, you can score one of your dwarves as an animal of your choice instead.
160803.name: Caverna: LARP and Cosplay Postcard

160804.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the Soccer World Championship 2014 in Brasilia.
160804.name: Monopoly: Brasilien

160806.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from
the national German soccer team 'Die Nationalmannschaft'; tokens, cards, properties and other game elements have been themed in line with this edition.
160806.name: Monopoly: Die Nationalmannschaft

160810.description:
The Other Side of Hollywood is a Kickstarter exclusive add-on which consists of 21 brand new cards. All of these cards have a special ability: you can pass a card to another player or you can use this card in your own movie.

Why would you want to pass the cards? Because they affect usual movie production rules and impose some limitations! Here is an example. Producer’s Son is not very skilled and he will decrease your box office with his terrible acting. However, he is still an Actor. The decision to keep him or to pass him is yours!

Art House Actress, on the other hand, is quite experienced but you can’t add any green crew cards to her movie. Why? Well, art house movies usually don’t need any special effects or anything that high budget team can offer.

If you got an “Other Side” card from another player you have to use it in your movie. You can’t get rid of it by discarding it! All of the “Other Side” cards have a ten-pointed star in the background to be easily recognizable.

The Other Side of Hollywood shows you the darker side of Hollywood but does it in a light-hearted manner. It is worth mentioning that all of the add-on’s cards are optional to use. You can add all of the new cards in to the deck or try any combinations.

More interaction to the game. More strategies to try. More interesting decisions to make!
160810.name: Hollywood: The Other Side of Hollywood

160811.name: Psychological Combat
160811.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bring the opportunity to secure victory into your own hands with Psychological Combat! From the designer who brought you the Pact Magic Unbound series and the Everyman Gaming blog, Psychological Combat gives players all of the tools they need to feint, demoralize, and antagonize their way to victory! Within, you will find:

Psychology DC, a new, easy to calculate statistic designed to streamline the rules presented in Psychological Combat.
Antagonize, a new special action that any character can take during combat to goad foes into focusing their violence upon you.
Morale, a new subsystem that GMs can use to help them determine when their cravenly monsters have taken more punishment than they can bear.
Updated rules for demoralizing and feinting in the midst of battle.
New archetypes that allow any martial character to assault the minds and morale of opponents.
New feats that enhance the special actions revealed and refined within Psychological Combat.
Mythic feats.
Character traits.
And much, much more!

160812.name: Xenopedia (Legend)
160812.description:
From publisher blurb:

Geremiah walked toward the door. “Let’s do it then.” He tapped on the control box to open the door, then stepped back to allow Sthol to fire through.

Sthol let out a long burst of flames to cut through the mist. The noise had its intended effect as the larger creatures turned to investigate. Sthol released his handflamer and waited for them to approach. Upon seeing the first creature in the doorway, he pulled the trigger again, dousing the creature with flames.

Malakai and Theth flanked Sthol, cutting down the enflamed creature with precision. Dahn’tyu and Geremiah held back, should any get through. Two more creatures appeared and Sthol repeated the process. Only one fell from the handflamer, but the other was quickly dispatched by axe and sword. However, the creatures did not relent.

Welcome to Mercenary Breed 2.0!

Mercenary Breed is a science fiction action and adventure toolkit and sandbox setting for Legend. The core setting set is broken into three rulebooks: Mercenary’s Handbook, Galaxy Guide, and Xenopedia. The Xenopedia is a collection of adversaries including those used in the missions and Legendary Tales in the Galaxy Guide.

Although Xenopedia is designed for use with Mercenary Breed, it’s actually a completely universal science fiction adversary book, usable with any science fiction setting or campaign, published or homebrewed. The xenos listed therein don’t rely on the Mercenary’s Handbook or Galaxy Guide to be usable, although they are utilized by the Galaxy Guide. Their backgrounds and motivations can be placed within any galaxy!

Xenopedia includes:

35 different xenos species including…
Intelligent species.
Non-organic species.
Animal-like species.
Monstrous species.
… and more!

A simple rating system to better understand the species.
Villains.
Illustrations for each species.

160813.name: Gygax Magazine (Issue 4 - Summer 2014)
160813.description:
This is the fourth issue of Gygax Magazine

Gygax Magazine is the Quarterly Adventure Gaming Magazine which started publishing in the first quarter of 2013.

The magazine was founded by several veterans of the RPG industry along with Gary Gygax's two sons.

160814.description:
Cartoon Network Fluxx is a card game in which the cards themselves determine the current rules of the game. By playing cards, you change numerous aspects of the game: how to draw cards, how to play cards, and even how to win. At the start of the game, each player holds three cards and on a turn a player draws one card, then plays one card. By playing cards, you can put new rules into play that change numerous aspects of the game: how many cards to draw or play, how many cards you can hold in hand or keep on the table in front of you, and (most importantly) how to win the game.

CN Fluxx features characters from nine different Cartoon Network shows, including Samurai Jack, The Powerpuff Girls, Ed, Edd n Eddy, Gumball, Adventure Time, "Dexter's Laboratory", "Johnny Bravo" and Regular Show.
160814.name: Cartoon Network Fluxx

160815.name: Mercenary Breed: Galaxy Guide (Legend)
160815.description:
From publisher blurb:

The mercenaries all nodded their agreement. Dahn’tyu spoke up. “Maybe we can lure the big ones out, into this cafeteria. If we can take them out in small groups, we should prevail. The smaller ones do not seem to be much of a threat, but I am uncertain about the bloated one.”

Dahn’tyu reached out with his psionic powers. “I do not detect any movement throughout that ventilation system, nor do I hear any scratching on the other side of the door. I do not believe they are aware of our presence. We should proceed with the plan and take out as many as we can in this room. The bloated one did not look small enough to fit through the door.”

The mercenaries nodded their agreement. “I can lure them out with my handflamer. It should startle them enough to at least investigate,” said Sthol.

Welcome to Mercenary Breed 2.0!

Mercenary Breed is a science fiction action and adventure toolkit and sandbox setting for Legend. The core setting set is broken into three rulebooks: Mercenary’s Handbook, Galaxy Guide, and Xenopedia. The Galaxy Guide is the Game Master’s guide including everything they need to build their own galaxy, expand on the Argo Galaxy sandbox setting with new planets and corporations, and create missions.

Mercenary Breed is designed to embrace all styles of science fiction setting and campaign design with a number of toolkits and discussions to make that happen. Galaxy Guide provides a number of building kits and discussions to allow the Game Master to create whatever science fiction themed setting or campaign they desire.

Galaxy Guide includes:

Details about the Argo Galaxy and how to create your own.
Five planets and a toolkit to create your own.
Four megacorporations and a toolkit to create your own.
Information on how to utilize other employers that are not megacorporations.
A guide for traveling through outer space.
GM advice on creating sci-fi missions.
A toolkit to create random missions.
Three sample adventures.
A collection of Legendary Tales.
… and much more!

160817.name: The Ascension of Hastorang
160817.description:
User summary:

A modern adventure for Call of Cthulhu that takes place during 5 weeks in the fall of 1962 in Los Angeles, California. A summer heat wave is the result of a particular planetary alignment that will come to its fulfillment on October 20. On this date Turkish cultists will attempt to call Cthugha forth from his home on Fomalhaut to re-establish his divine rule here on Earth.

160818.name: Mercenary's Handbook (Legend)
160818.description:
From publisher blurb:

The mercenaries spied a small door to their right which led into the warehouse. The mist only became thicker the closer they approached the door. Assuming their regular positions, Geremiah tapped the control box. The mercenaries froze as they stared into the creatures’ nest. Sthol reached out and tapped the control box again, closing the door. The mercenaries stepped back, staring at each other with discerning looks.

Sthol looked deeply at the others. “Did you see that?”

Geremiah nodded his head. “It looks like the nest. There was some giant, bulbous creature on the far side, probably a hundred of those skittering, scorpion things, and a handful of the larger ones. This must be the mother, and those little ones must be her offspring. I’m assuming they grow into the larger creatures we’ve already fought.” Geremiah glanced toward the far wall. Using his night vision goggles, he could see vents along the way. “The small ones must be traversing the ship through the vents. They must fall into the rooms, get stuck, and grow into the larger ones. That explains why the control boxes are all intact.”

Welcome to Mercenary Breed 2.0!

Mercenary Breed is a science fiction action and adventure toolkit and sandbox setting for Legend. The core setting set is broken into three rulebooks: Mercenary’s Handbook, Galaxy Guide, and Xenopedia. The Mercenary’s Handbook is the player’s guide including everything they need to create characters across a multitude of science fiction themes including space opera, sci-fi horror, and pulp sci-fi. Characters could be bounty hunters, scouts, helmsmen, demolitions experts, biohackers, neuromancers, scientists, engineers, and a whole lot more!

Mercenary Breed is designed to embrace all styles of science fiction setting and campaign design with a number of toolkits and discussions to make that happen. Mercenary’s Handbook provides the character options players can choose from to create those different characters including those utilizing Tech Professions – the sci-fi equivalent of magic, but based on technology.

Mercenary’s Handbook includes:

6 xeno templates representing different species for the characters to choose from.
Reputation-based equipment requisition.
50 sci-fi Professions.
New Heroic Abilities.
Sci-fi weapons, armor, and equipment to choose from.
Information on how to apply different sci-fi themes.
6 Tech Professions.
… and much more!

160819.name: Arcatype
160819.description:
Arcatype is a combination of elements from strategy card games coupled with tactical-based unit placement on a hexagonal map with a number of capture points for players to fight over.
